hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated that :the Prophet said: "Jibril (peace be upon him) led me (in Salat) twice at the House. So he prayed Zuhr the first time when the shadow was similar to (the length of) the strap a sandal. Then he prayed Asr when everything was similar (to the length of) its shadow. Then he prayed Maghrib when the sun had set and the fasting person breaks fast. Then he prayed Isha when the twilight had vanished. Then he prayed Fajr when Fajr (dawn) began, and when eating is prohibited for the fasting person. The second time he prayed Zuhr when the shadow of everything was similar to (the length of) it, at the time of Asr the day before. Then he prayed Asr when the shadow of everything was about twice as long as it. Then he prayed Maghrib at the same time as he did the first time. Then he prayed Isha, the later one, when a third of the night had gone. Then he prayed Subh when the land glowed. Then Jibril turned towards me and said: "O Muhammad! These are the times of the Prophets before you, and the (best) time is what is between these two times

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مَوَاقِيتِ الصَّلاَةِ عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Prescribed Times for Salat From The Prophet

hadiths.text: Jabir bin Abdullah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Jibril led me (in Salat)". He mentioned something similar to the Hadith of Ibn Abbas (no. 149) in meaning, but he did not mention: "At the time of Asr the day before

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مَوَاقِيتِ الصَّلاَةِ عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Prescribed Times for Salat From The Prophet

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Indeed for (the time of) Salat (there is a) beginning and an end. The beginning of the time for the Zuhr prayer is when the sun passes the zenith, and the end of its time is when the time for Asr enters. The beginning of the time for the Asr [prayer] is when its time enters, and the end of its time is when the sun yellows (turns pale). The beginning of the time of Maghrib is when the sun as set, and the end of its time is when the twilight has vanished (i.e., the horizon is invisible because of darkness). The beginning of the time for Isha, the later one, is when the horizon has vanished, and the end of its time is when the night is at its half. The beginning of the time for Fajr is when Fajr begins, and its end is when the sun rises

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something else (about the timings of Salat)

hadiths.text: Sulaiman bin Buraidah narrated that his father said:"A man came to the Prophet to ask him about the times for Salat. So he said: 'Stay with us, In sha Allah.' So he ordered Bilal to call the Iqamah when Fajr began, then he ordered him to call the Iqamah when the Sun passed the zenith, then he prayed Zuhr. Then he ordered him to call the Iqamah to pray Asr while the sun was elevated and white. Then he ordered him (to call the Iqamah for) Maghrib when the (top) edge of the sun had set. Then he ordered him to call the Iqamah for Isha when the horizon (twilight) had vanished. Then he ordered him in the morning (to give the call for Fajr prayer), when the light of Fajr glowed. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Zuhr, so he waited well until it had cooled. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Asr, so he calIed the Iqamah while the sun was later in its position than what it was (the day before). Then he ordered him to delay Maghrib until right before the twilight had disappeared. Then he ordered (him to call the Iqamah for) Isha, so he called the Iqamah when a third of the night had passed. Then he said: 'Where is the one who asked about he times for the Salat?' So the man said, 'It is I.' So he said: 'The times [or the Salat are what are between these two]

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something else

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger would pray Subh (at such time that) the women would leave (after the prayer)" - AI-AnsarI (one of the narrators) said - the women would pass by wrapped in their Mirts and they would not be recognizable due to the darkness." And Qutaibah said: "covered." (instead of "wrapped)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّغْلِيسِ بِالْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Praying Fajr In The Dark

hadiths.text: Rafi bin Khadlj said:"I heard Allah's Messenger saying: 'Perform Fajr at AI-Isfar, for indeed its reward is greater

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الإِسْفَارِ بِالْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Al-Isfar In Fajr

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"I have not seen anyone who hastened Zuhr more than Allah's Messenger nor Abu Bakr, nor Umar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّعْجِيلِ بِالظُّهْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Hastening Zuhr

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"Allah's Messenger prayed Zuhr when the sun had passed the zenith

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّعْجِيلِ بِالظُّهْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Hastening Zuhr

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "In very hot weather, delay the (Zuhr) prayer until it becomes (a bit) cooler, because the severity of heat is from the raging of the Hell

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ الظُّهْرِ فِي شِدَّةِ الْحَرِّ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying Zuhr In Severe Heat

hadiths.text: Abu Dharr narrated:"Allah's Messenger was on a journey and Bilal was with him. So he wanted to call for the prayer, but he (the Prophet) said: 'Let it get cooler.' Then he wanted to call for the prayer, so Allah's Messenger said: 'Let it get to the cooler time of Zuhr.'" He (i.e., Abu Dharr) said: "Until we saw the shadows of the hillocks, then he commanded that the Iqamah be called and then led the people in prayer. Allah's Messenger said: 'The severity of heat is from the raging of Hell, so wait until it becomes cooler for the (Zuhr) prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ الظُّهْرِ فِي شِدَّةِ الْحَرِّ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying Zuhr In Severe Heat

hadiths.text: Urwah narrated from Aishah:"Allah's Messenger prayed Asr while the sun was (shining) in her chamber, (and) no shadow appeared in her chamber

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَعْجِيلِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Hastening Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Al-Ala bin Abdur-Raman narrated that :he visited Anas bin Malik in his home in Al Basrah after finishing Zuhr, and his home was next to the Masjid. So he said: 'Stand to pray Asr." He (Al-Ala) said: "So we stood to pray. When we were finished he (Anas) said: 'I heard Allah's Messenger saying: "That is the prayer of the hypocrite. He sits watching the sun, until when it is between the horns of the Shaitan he stands and pecks out four (units of prayer), not remembering Allah in them but a little

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَعْجِيلِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Hastening Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Umm Salamah narrated:"Allah's Messenger would hasten Zuhr more than you (people), while you (people) hasten Asr more than him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Narrator not mentioned:[And I have in my book: "Ali bin Hujr informed me from lsma'il bin Ibrahim, from Ibn Juraij]

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Similar narration is reported by Bishr ibn Mu'adh Al-Bari who said that :Isma'il ibn Ulayyah narrated to him from Ibn Juraij. This latter chain is more correct

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Asr Prayer

hadiths.text: Salmah bin AI-Akwa narrated:"Allah's Messenger prayed Maghrib when the sun had set and it (the sun) had hidden in the veil (of darkness)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَقْتِ الْمَغْرِبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Time For Maghrib

hadiths.text: An-Nu'man bin Bashir said:"I am the most knowledgeable among the people about the prescribed time of this prayer: Allah's Messenger would pray it when the moon set on the third (of the month)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَقْتِ صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Time For The Last Isha Prayer

hadiths.text: An-Nu'man bin Bashir said:A similar narration (from another chain linking to) this chain is also reported

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَقْتِ صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Time For The Last Isha Prayer

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "If it were not that it would be a hardship on my Ummah, then I would have ordered you to delay Isha until the third of the night, or its half

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَأْخِيرِ صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ الآخِرَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Delaying The Last Isha Prayer

hadiths.text: Abu Barzah narrated:"The Prophet would dislike to sleep before Isha and to talk after it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ النَّوْمِ قَبْلَ الْعِشَاءِ وَالسَّمَرِ بَعْدَهَا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Sleep Before Isha And To Talk During The Night After It

hadiths.text: Umar bin Al-Khattab narrated:"Allah's Messenger would talk during the night with Abu Bakr about matters concerning the Muslims while I was with them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مِنَ الرُّخْصَةِ فِي السَّمَرِ بَعْدَ الْعِشَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Permitting Talk After Isha

hadiths.text: Umm Farwah - and she was one of those who gave pledge of allegiance to the Prophet - narrated:"The Prophet was asked: 'Which deed is the best?' So he said: 'Salat in the beginning of its time

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Ali bin AbI Talib narrated that :the Prophet said to him: 'Ali! Three are not to be delayed: Salat when its time comes, a funeral whet it (a prepared body) is present, and the (marriage of a) single woman when there is an equal for her

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The beginning of the time for Salat is pleasing to Allah, and the end of its time is pardoned by Allah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Abu Amr Ash-Shaibani narrated:"A man said to Ibn Mas'ud: 'Which deed is most virtuous?' He said: 'I asked Allah's Messenger (that). He said: "Salat at the beginning of its time." I asked him: "What is after that O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Being dutiful to one's parents." I said: "What is after that [O Messenger of Allah]?" He said: "Jihad in the Way of Allah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger did not pray any Salat at the end of its time two times, until Allah took him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْوَقْتِ الأَوَّلِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: Virtue Of Performing Salat at the Beginning Of Its Prescribed Time

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever misses the Asr prayer, then it is as if he was robbed of his family and his property

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي السَّهْوِ عَنْ وَقْتِ، صَلاَةِ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Forgetting The rime Of Asr

hadiths.text: Abu Dharr narrated that :the Prophet said: "O Abu Dharr! There will be leaders after me who cause the Salat to die; so perform the Salat during its time. If you pray (with them) during its time, then that will be voluntary Salat for you, if not, then you will have attained your Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَعْجِيلِ الصَّلاَةِ إِذَا أَخَّرَهَا الإِمَامُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Hastening The Salat When The Imam Delays It

hadiths.text: Abu Qatadah narrated:"They asked the Prophet about when they sIept past the Salat. He said: 'There is no negligence in sleep, negligence is only while one is awake. So when one of you forgets a Salat, or sleeps through it, then let him pray it when he remembers it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي النَّوْمِ عَنِ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Sleeping Past The Salat

hadiths.text: Anas (bin Malik) narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever forgets a Salat then he is to pray it when he remembers it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَنْسَى الصَّلاَةَ
chapter.eng-name: Been Related About A Man Who Forgets A Salat

hadiths.text: Abdullah (bin Mas'ud] narrated:"The idolaters kept Allah's Messenger distracted from four prayers on the Day of Al-Khandaq (the battle of the Trench) until as much as Allah willed of the night had passed. So he ordered Bilal to call the Adhan, then he called the Iqamah to Zuhr, then he called the Iqamah to pray Asr, then he called the Iqamah to pray Maghrib, then he called the Iqamah to pray Isha

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ تَفُوتُهُ الصَّلَوَاتُ بِأَيَّتِهِنَّ يَبْدَأُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Misses Multiple Prayers And Which Of Them He Begin With

hadiths.text: Jabir bin Abdullah narrated:"On the Day of Al-Khandaq (the battle of the Trench), Umar bin Al-Khattab came cursing the disbelievers of Quraish and said: 'O Allah's Messenger! I could not offer he Asr prayer until the sun was about to set.' The Prophet said: 'By Allah! I too have not offered the Salat.'" So he said: "We descended into Buthan, Allah's Messenger performed Wudu and we too performed Wudu. Allah's Messenger prayed Asr after the sun had set, then after it he prayed Maghrib

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ تَفُوتُهُ الصَّلَوَاتُ بِأَيَّتِهِنَّ يَبْدَأُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Misses Multiple Prayers And Which Of Them He Begin With

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Salatul-Wusta is the Asr prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي صَلاَةِ الْوُسْطَى أَنَّهَا الْعَصْرُ وَقَدْ قِيلَ إِنَّهَا الظُّهْرُ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About "Salatul-Wusta" [And It Has Been Said That It Is Zuhr]

hadiths.text: Smurah bin Jundub narrated that :the Prophet said: "Salatul-wusta is the Asr prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي صَلاَةِ الْوُسْطَى أَنَّهَا الْعَصْرُ وَقَدْ قِيلَ إِنَّهَا الظُّهْرُ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About "Salatul-Wusta" [And It Has Been Said That It Is Zuhr]

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"I head more than one of the Companions of the Prophet; Umar bin Al-Khattab among, and he was one of the most beloved among them to me - (narrating) that Allah's Messenger prohibited the Salat after Fajr until the sun had risen, and the Salat after Asr until the sun had set

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الصَّلاَةِ بَعْدَ الْعَصْرِ وَبَعْدَ الْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Prayer After Asr And After Fajr Is Disliked

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"The Prophet only performed the two rak'ah (units of prayer) after Asr because some wealth came to him which distracted him from the two rak'ah after Zuhr, so he prayed them after Asr, then he did not repeat that

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ بَعْدَ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Salat After Asr

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mughaffal narrated that :the Prophet said: "Between every two calls (to prayer) there is a Salat for whoever wills

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ قَبْلَ الْمَغْرِبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat Before Maghrib

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever catches a Rak'ah of Subh before the sun has risen, then he has caught Subh. Whoever catches a Rak'ah of Asr before the sun has set, then he has caught Asr

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ أَدْرَكَ رَكْعَةً مِنَ الْعَصْرِ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَغْرُبَ الشَّمْسُ
chapter.eng-name: , What Has Been Related About One Who Caught A Rak'ah About One Asr Before The Sun Has Set

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas said:"Allah's Messenger combined the Zuhr and Asr (prayers), and the Maghrib and Isha (prayers) in Al-Madinah, without being in a state of fear, nor due to rain

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجَمْعِ بَيْنَ الصَّلاَتَيْنِ فِي الْحَضَرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers While [A Resident]

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever combines two prayers without any excuse then he has committed something from the major sins

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجَمْعِ بَيْنَ الصَّلاَتَيْنِ فِي الْحَضَرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Combining Two Prayers While [A Resident]

hadiths.text: Albdullah bin Zaid narrated:"When we awoke, we went to Allah's Messenger to inform him of the dream. He said: 'Indeed this dream is true. So go to Bilal, for he has a better and louder voice than you. Convey to him what was said to you, so that he may call (to the prayer) with that.'" He said: "When Umar bin Al-Khattab heard Bilal calling for the prayer he went to Allah's Messenger, and he was dragging his Izar, (as he was hurrying) saying: 'O Allah's Messenger! By the One Who sent you with the truth! I dreamt the same as what he said.''' He said: "So Allah's Messenger said: 'To Allah is the praise, so that confirms it even more

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي بَدْءِ الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About How the Adhan Started

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"When the Muslims arrived in AI-Madinah, they used to assemble for the Salat, and guess the time for it there was no one who called for it (the prayer). One day they discussed that and some of them said that they should use a bell like the bell the Christians use. Others said they should use a trumpet like the horn the Jews use. But Umar [bin Al-Khattab] said: 'Wouldn't it better if we had a man call for the prayer?'" He said: "So Allah's Messenger said: 'O Bilal! Stand up and call for the Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي بَدْءِ الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About How the Adhan Started

hadiths.text: Abu Mahdhurah narrated that :Allah's Messenger sat with him and taught him the Adhan word for word. Ibrahim said, "It is the same as our Adhan." Bishr said: "So I said to him, 'Repeat it to me.' So he described the Adhan with At-Tarjl

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّرْجِيعِ فِي الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About At-Tarji In The Adhan

hadiths.text: Abu Mahdhurah narrated that :the Prophet taught him the Adhan with nineteen phrases, and the Iqamah with seventeen phrases

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّرْجِيعِ فِي الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About At-Tarji In The Adhan

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"Bilal was ordered to make the phrases of the Adhan even, and the phrases of the Iqamah odd

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِفْرَادِ الإِقَامَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Saying The Phrases Of The lqamah Once

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Zaid said:"Allah's Messenger would say each phrase of the call (for prayer) two times, for the Adhan and the Iqamah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الإِقَامَةَ مَثْنَى مَثْنَى
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Saying The Phrases Of The Iqamah Two Times Each

hadiths.text: Jabir [bin Abdullah] narrated:"Allah's Messenger said to Bilal: "O Bilal! When you call the Adhan then do so deliberately and slowly, and when you call the Iqamah then be quick. Allow enough time between your Adhan and Iqamah for the person eating to finish what he is eating, the person drinking to finish what he is drinking, and the one who needs time to relive himself, and do not stand until you see me

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّرَسُّلِ فِي الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Saying The Phrases Of The Adhan With Deliberateness And Slowly

hadiths.text: Jabir [bin Abdullah] narrated:(Another chain for) a similar narration (as no)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّرَسُّلِ فِي الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Saying The Phrases Of The Adhan With Deliberateness And Slowly

hadiths.text: Abu Juhaifah narrated:"I saw Bilal calling the Adhan, and turning, and his (face) was following here and there, and his (index) fingers were in his ears, and Allah's Messenger was in a small red tent" - "I think," he (one of the narrators) said, "it was made from a hide" - so Bilal went out in front of him with an Anazah which he planted (in the ground) at Batha. Allah's Messenger prayed facing it, and a dog and a donkey passed in front of him; he was wearing a red Hullah, and it is as if I am now looking at the radiance of his shins." Sufyan said: "We think that it was a Hibrah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِدْخَالِ الإِصْبَعِ فِي الأُذُنِ عِنْدَ الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Putting The Fingers In The Ears For The Adhan

hadiths.text: Bilal narrated:"Allah's Messenger said [to me]: 'Do not say the Tathwib for any prayer except the Fajr prayer.'" [He said:] There is something on this topic from Abu Mahdhurah. Abu `Eisa said: We do not know of the Hadith of Bilal except as a narration of Abu Isra'il Al-Mula'i. Abu Isra'il did not hear this Hadith from Al-Hakam bin `Utaibah. He said: He only reported it from Al-Hasan bin `Umarah, from Al-Hakam bin `Utaibah. Abu Isra'il's name is [Isma`il bin Abi Ishaq, and he is not strong according to the people of Hadith. The people of knowledge have differed over the interpretation of At-Tathwib. Some of them say that At-Tathwib is when one says "As-Salatu Khairummin An-Nawm, (prayer is better than sleep)" for the Adhan of Fajr. This is the saying of Ibn Al-Mubarak and Ahmad. Ishaq said something different about At-Tathwib, he said: "[The disliked Tathwib] is something that the people started after the Prophet; when the Mu'adh-dhin calls the Adhan and the people are slow in coming, so between the Adhan and the Iqamah he says: 'Qad Qamatis-Salat, Hayya `Alasalat, Hayya `AlalFalah. (Prayer is ready, come to prayer, come to success.)" [He said:] This Tathwib, which Ishaq mentioned, is the one that the people of knowledge dislike, which they innovated after the Prophet. But Ibn Al-Mubarak and Ahmad explained that At-Tathwib is when the Mu'adh-dhin says: "As-Salatu Khairum minan-Nawm, (prayer is better than sleep)" for the Adhan of Fajr. And this is the correct saying, and it is called At-Tathawwub as well, and this is the one chosen by the people of knowledge, and it is their opinion. It has been reported from `Abdullah bin `Umar that he would say: "As-Salatu Khairum-minan-Nawm, (prayer is better than sleep)" for Fajr. It has been reported from Mujahid that he said: "I entered a Masjid with `Abdullah bin `Umar in which the Adhan was called, and we wanted to pray in it. Then the Mu'adh-dhin said the Tathwib. So `Abdullah bin `Umar left the Masjid and said: 'Let us leave the place of this innovator' And he did not pray in it." [He said:] `Abdullah only disliked the Tathwib that the people invented later on

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّثْوِيبِ فِي الْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About AI-Tathwib In The Adhan

hadiths.text: Ziyad bin Al-Harith As-Suda'i narrated:"Allah's Messenger ordered me to call the Adhan for the Fajr prayer. I called the Adhan, then Bilal wanted to call the lqamah. Allah's Messenger said: 'Indeed the brother from Suda' has called the Adhan, and whoever calls the Adhan he calls the Iqamah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ مَنْ أَذَّنَ فَهُوَ يُقِيمُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Whoever Calls The Adhan, He Is To Call The Iqamah

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "None should call the Adhan except for one with Wudu

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الأَذَانِ بِغَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Call The Adhan Without Having Wudu

hadiths.text: Ibn Shihab narrated that :Abu Hurairah said: "None should call (for the prayer except for one with Wudu)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الأَذَانِ بِغَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Call The Adhan Without Having Wudu

hadiths.text: Jabir bin Samurah narrated:The Mu'adh-dhin of Allah's Messenger would wait and he would not call the Iqamah until he saw the Allah's Messenger had come out, he would call the Iqamah when he saw him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الإِمَامَ أَحَقُّ بِالإِقَامَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That The Imam Has be Greatest Right To The Iqamah

hadiths.text: Salim narrated from his father (Ibn Umar) that :the Prophet said: "Indeed Bilal calls the Adhan in the night, so eat and drink until you hear the Adhan of Ibn Umm Maktum

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الأَذَانِ بِاللَّيْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Adhan At Night

hadiths.text: Abu Ash-Sha'tha said:"A man exited the Masjid after the Adhan for Asr had been called. So Abu Hurairah said: 'As for this person, he has indeed disobeyed Abul Qasim

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الْخُرُوجِ مِنَ الْمَسْجِدِ بَعْدَ الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Dislike For Exiting The Masjid After The Adhan

hadiths.text: Malik bin Al-Huwairih said:"A cousin of mine and I arrived as guests of Allah's Messenger. He said to us: 'When you travel then call the Adhan and Iqamah and let the eldest of you lead the prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الأَذَانِ فِي السَّفَرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Adhan While Traveling

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"The Prophet said: 'Whoever calls the Adhan for seven years, seeking reward for it, salvation from the Fire is written for him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الأَذَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtues Of The Adhan

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The Imam is answerable and the Mu'adh-dhin is entrusted. O Allah! Guide the Imams and pardon the Mu'adh-dhins

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الإِمَامَ ضَامِنٌ وَالْمُؤَذِّنَ مُؤْتَمَنٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That The Imam Is Answerable and the Mu'adh-dhin Is Entrusted

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Whenyou hear the call (to prayer) then say the similar to what the Mu'adh-dhin says

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مَا يَقُولُ الرَّجُلُ إِذَا أَذَّنَ الْمُؤَذِّنُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About What Is Said [by A Man] When the Mu'adh-dhin Calls The Adhan

hadiths.text: Uthman bin Abi Al-As narrated:"Indeed, amount the last (of orders) Allah's Messenger ordered me with was to employ a Mu'adh-dhin who would not take a wage for his Adhan

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ الْمُؤَذِّنُ عَلَى الأَذَانِ أَجْرًا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Dislike For The Mu'adh-dhin Taking A Wage For the Adhan

hadiths.text: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever says, when he hears the Mu'adh-dhin: (Wa Ana Ashadu An La Ilaha Illallah, Wahdahu La Sharika Lahu, Wa Anna Muhammadan Abduhu Wa Rasuluhu, Radittu Billahi Rabban Wa Bil-Islam Dinan, Wa Bi Muhammadin Rasulan) 'I too testify that none has the right to be worshiped but Allah, Alone without partners, and that Muhammad is His slave and Messenger, I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion and Muhammad as a Messenger.' - Allah will pardon his sins for him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مَا يَقُولُ الرَّجُلُ إِذَا أَذَّنَ الْمُؤَذِّنُ مِنَ الدُّعَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] What Supplications Is Said [By A Muslim] When The Mu'adh-dhin Calls The Adhan

hadiths.text: Jabir bin Abdullah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever says, when he hears the call: (Allahumma, rabba hadhihidda 'watit-tammati was Salatilqa'imah, ati Muhammadanil wasilata wal-Fadilata, wab'athhu Maqamun Mahmudan alladhi wa'adtahu) 'O Allah! Lord of this perfect call and established prayer, grant Muhammad Al-Wasilah and Al-Fadilah, and raise him to the praised station that you promised him' - then intercession on the Day of Resurrection is made lawful for him

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ آخَرُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The supplication made between the Adhan and Iqamah is not rejected

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي أَنَّ الدُّعَاءَ لاَ يُرَدُّ بَيْنَ الأَذَانِ وَالإِقَامَةِ
chapter.eng-name: Supplication Made Between Adhan and Iqamah Is Not Rejected

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"On the Night of Isra, fifty prayers were made obligatory upon the Prophet. Then it was decreased until it was made five. Then it was called out: 'O Muhammad! Indeed My Word does not change; these five prayers will be recorded for you as fifty

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ كَمْ فَرَضَ اللَّهُ عَلَى عِبَادِهِ مِنَ الصَّلَوَاتِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About How Many Prayers Allah Made Obligatory Upon His Servants

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The five prayers, and Al-Jumuah (the Friday prayer) to Al-Jumuah are atonement for what is between them, as long as the major sins have not been committed

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الصَّلَوَاتِ الْخَمْسِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Virtue Of The Five Prayers

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Salat in congregation is twenty-seven degrees more virtuous than a man's Salat alone

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الْجَمَاعَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About the Virtue Of Salat In Congregation

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Indeed a man's Salat in the congregation is increased by twenty five rewards over his Salat alone

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الْجَمَاعَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About the Virtue Of Salat In Congregation

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "I was about to order my boys to collect bundles of firewood, then order Salat to be held, then burn (the homes) of the people who did not attend the Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ يَسْمَعُ النِّدَاءَ فَلاَ يُجِيبُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About One Who Heard the Call (to Prayer) But Did Not Respond To It

hadiths.text: Mujahid said:"Ibn Abbas was asked about a man who fasted during the day and stood (in prayers) during the night, but he did not attend the Friday prayer nor congregational prayer. He replied: 'He is in the Fire

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ يَسْمَعُ النِّدَاءَ فَلاَ يُجِيبُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About One Who Heard the Call (to Prayer) But Did Not Respond To It

hadiths.text: Jabir hin Yazid hin Al-Aswad [Al-Amir] narrated that his father said:"I attended Hajj with the Prophet. I prayed the Subh (Fajr) prayer with him in Masjid AI-Khaif." He said: "When the Prophet finished, he turned (from the Qiblah) and saw two men at the back of the people who had not prayed with him. He said, 'Bring them to me.' So I brought then while they were shuddering with fear. He said: 'What prevented you from praying with us?" They said: 'O Messenger of Allah!' We prayed at our camp.' So he said: 'Do not do that; when you pray in your camp then you come to a Masjid with a congregation, then pray with them. That will be a voluntary prayer for you

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَحْدَهُ ثُمَّ يُدْرِكُ الْجَمَاعَةَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Man Who Performs Salat Alone, Then He Comes Upon A Congregation

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed narrated:"A man came when Allah's Messenger had already prayed, so he said: 'Which of you will give some reward to this person?' So a man stood to pray with him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْجَمَاعَةِ فِي مَسْجِدٍ قَدْ صُلِّيَ فِيهِ مَرَّةً
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About The Congregation In The Masjid Being Held Two Times

hadiths.text: Uthman bin Affan narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever attends Isha (prayer) in congregation, then he has (the reward as if he had) stood half of the night. And whoever prays Isha and Fajr in congregation, then he has (the reward as if he had) spend the entire night standing (in prayer)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الْعِشَاءِ وَالْفَجْرِ فِي الْجَمَاعَةِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Isha And Fajr In Congregation

hadiths.text: Jundub bin Sufyan narrated that :the Prophet said: "Whoever prays the Subh then he is under the protection of Allah's covenant, so do not be treacherous with Allah in his covenant

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الْعِشَاءِ وَالْفَجْرِ فِي الْجَمَاعَةِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Isha And Fajr In Congregation

hadiths.text: Buraidah Al-Aslami narrated that :the Prophet said: "Give glad tiding to those who walk to the Masajid in the dark; of a complete light on the Day of Resurrection

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الْعِشَاءِ وَالْفَجْرِ فِي الْجَمَاعَةِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Isha And Fajr In Congregation

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The best rows for the men are the first of them, and the worst are the last of them. And the best rows for the women are the last of them, and the worst are the first of them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الصَّفِّ الأَوَّلِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The First Row

hadiths.text: Narrator not mentioned:And the Prophet said: "If the people knew what (reward) is in the call (Adhan) and the first row, and they found no other way to get that except drawing lots, then they would draw lots

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الصَّفِّ الأَوَّلِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The First Row

hadiths.text: Narrator not mentioned:A Similar narration

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ الصَّفِّ الأَوَّلِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The First Row

hadiths.text: An-Nu'man bin Bashir said:"Allah's Messenger would straighten our lines. One day he came out and saw a man whose chest was protruding from the people, so he said: 'You must straighten your lines, or Allah will cause disagreement to occur among your faces

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِقَامَةِ الصُّفُوفِ
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About Keeping the Rows Straight

hadiths.text: Abdullah (Ibn Masud) narrated that :the Prophet said: "Let those among you with understanding and reason be close to me, then those after them, then those after them. And do not separate or dissention will occur among your hearts, and beware of the commotion of the markets

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ لِيَلِيَنِي مِنْكُمْ أُولُو الأَحْلاَمِ وَالنُّهَى
chapter.eng-name: : What Has Been Related About "Let Those Among You With Understanding And Reason Be Close To Me."

hadiths.text: Abdul-Hamid bin Mahmud said:"We prayed behind one of the Amirs, the people compelled us such that we prayed between two columns. When we had prayed, Anas bin Malik said: 'We would be prevented from this during the time of Allah's Messenger

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الصَّفِّ بَيْنَ السَّوَارِي
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Dislike For Forming Rows Between Columns

hadiths.text: Hilal bin Yasar said:"Ziyad bin Abi Al-Ja'd took me by the hand while we were in Ar Raqqah, he made me stand before a Shaikh who was called Wabisah bin Ma'bad, from Bani Asad. Ziyad said: 'This Shaikh narrated to me that a prayed alone behind the row' - and the Shaikh was listening - 'so Allah's Messenger ordered him to repeat the Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ خَلْفَ الصَّفِّ وَحْدَهُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat Behind The Line Alone

hadiths.text: Wabisah bin Ma'bad narrated:"A man prayed alone behind the row s the Prophet ordered him to repeat the Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ خَلْفَ الصَّفِّ وَحْدَهُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat Behind The Line Alone

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"I prayed with the Prophet one night. I stood at his left, so Allah's Messenger took me by my head, from behind me, to put me on his right (side)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَمَعَهُ رَجُلٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Prays While Another Man Is With Him

hadiths.text: Samurah bin Jundub narrated:"Allah's Messenger ordered us that when we were three, then one of us should stand forward

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي مَعَ الرَّجُلَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Prays With Two Men

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"My grandmother Mutalikah invited Allah's Messenger to a meal that she prepared. He ate from it, then said: 'Stand so tht we may lead you in prayer.'" He said: "I got a Hasir of our which had become dark because of prolonged use, so I washed it with water. Allah's Messenger stood on it, and the orphan and I aligned behind him and the only lady stood behind us. He (Allah's Messenger) led us in two Rak'ah of prayer and then left

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَمَعَهُ الرِّجَالُ وَالنِّسَاءُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Prays And A Man And A Woman Are With Him

hadiths.text: Abu Mas'ud narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The one who recites most of the Book of Allah is to lead the people (in prayers). If they are equal in recitation, then the most knowledgeable in the Sunnah among them. If they are equal regarding the Sunnah, then the earliest of them to emigrate. If they are equal in their emigration then the eldest among them. And a man is not to be led in prayer in the place of his authority, and his spot of esteem in his home is not to be sat on without his permission

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مَنْ أَحَقُّ بِالإِمَامَةِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] Who Is Most Deserving Of Being The Imam

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said: "When one of you leads the people in prayer then let him be brief, for indeed here are among them the young and the old, the weak and the ill. When one of you prays alone, then let him pray as he wishes

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ إِذَا أَمَّ أَحَدُكُمُ النَّاسَ فَلْيُخَفِّفْ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About: "When One Of You Leads The People In Prayer, Then Let Him Be Brief."

hadiths.text: Anas [bin Malik] narrated:"Allah's Messenger was among the lightest of people in Salat with its completeness

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ إِذَا أَمَّ أَحَدُكُمُ النَّاسَ فَلْيُخَفِّفْ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About: "When One Of You Leads The People In Prayer, Then Let Him Be Brief."

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "the key to Salat is the purification, its Tahrim is the Takbir, and its Tahlilis the Taslim, and there is no Salat for one who did not recite Al-Hamd and a Surah in the obligatory (prayer) or other prayers

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَحْرِيمِ الصَّلاَةِ وَتَحْلِيلِهَا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Tahrim And Tahlil Of Salat

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"When Allah's Messenger performed the Takbir for Salat he would spread his fingers

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي نَشْرِ الأَصَابِعِ عِنْدَ التَّكْبِيرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Spreading The Fingers With The Takbir

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"When Allah's Messenger would enter the Salat he would raise his hands while they were extended

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي نَشْرِ الأَصَابِعِ عِنْدَ التَّكْبِيرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Spreading The Fingers With The Takbir

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Whoever performs Salat for Allah for forty days in congregation, catching the first Takbir, two absolutions are written for him: absolution from the Fire, and absolution from the Fire, and absolution from hypocrisy

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ التَّكْبِيرَةِ الأُولَى
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About the Virtue Of the First Takbir

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eeed Al Khudri narrated:"When Allah;s Messenger stood for Salat during the night, he would say the Takbir (Allahu Akbar), then say: (Subhanaka Allahumma wa bihamdika wa Tabarakasmuka wa Ta'ala Jadduka wa la ilaha ghairuk.) 'Glorious You are O Allah, and with Your praise, and blesses is Your Name, and exalted is Your majesty, and none has the right to be worshipped but You' Then he would say: (A'udhu Bilahi As-Sami'il-Alimi min Ash-Shaitanir-Rajimi, min Hamzihi Wa Nafkhihi wa Nafthihi.)" 'Allah is undoubtedly the greatest.' (Allahu Akbaru Kabira). Then he would say: 'I seek refuge in Allah the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing, from the cursed Shaitan, from his madness, his arrogance, and his poetry

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ عِنْدَ افْتِتَاحِ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said During The Opening Of The Salat

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"When the Prophet opened the Salat he would say: (Subhanaka Allahumma wa bihamdika wa tabarakasmuka, wa ta'ala jadduka wa la ilaha ghairuk)" 'Glorious You are O Allah, and with Your praise, and blessed is Your Name, and exalted is Your majesty, and none has the right to be worshipped but You

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ عِنْدَ افْتِتَاحِ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said During The Opening Of The Salat

hadiths.text: Ibn Abdullah bin Mughaffal narrated:"While I was praying, I said: Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim "In the Name of Allah, the Merciful, the Beneficent." My father heard me and said: "O my son this is a newly invented matter, beware of the newly-invented.'" He (Ibn Abdullah) said: "I have not seen any one of the Companions of Allah's Messenger who hated a newly invented matter in Islam more than him. And he said: 'Ihave performed Salat with the Prophet, and with Abu Bakr, and Umar, and with Uthman. I did not hear any one of them saying it. So do not say it. When you are performing Salat say: Al-Hamdu lilahi Rabbil-Alamin "All praise is due to Allah the Lord of all that exists

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَرْكِ الْجَهْرِ بِـ (بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ )
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Not Saying "Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim (In The Name Of Allah, The Merciful, The Beneficient)" Aloud

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"The Prophet would open his Salat with (Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَنْ رَأَى الْجَهْرَ بِـ (بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ )
chapter.eng-name: Whoever Held The View That Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim Was Recited Aloud

hadiths.text: Anas narrated:"Allah's Messenger, Abu Bakr, Umar and Uthman opened the Salat with (Al-Hamdu-lillahi rabbil-alamin)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي افْتِتَاحِ الْقِرَاءَةِ بِـ (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ )
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Opening The Recitation With Al-Hamdulillahi Rabbil-Alamin (All Praise Is Due To Allah, The Lord Of All That Exits.)

hadiths.text: Ubadah bin As-Samil narrated that :the Prophet said: "There is no Salat for the one who does not recite Fatihatil-Kitab

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّهُ لاَ صَلاَةَ إِلاَّ بِفَاتِحَةِ الْكِتَابِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About: "There Is No Salat Except With Fatihatil-Kitab"

hadiths.text: Wa'il bin Hujr narrated:"I heard the Prophet recite: (Not (the way) of those who earned Your anger, nor those who went astray) and he said: 'Amin.' And he stretched it out with his voice

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّأْمِينِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About At-Ta'min

hadiths.text: (Another chain) from Wa'il bin Hujr who narrated it from :the Prophet, and it is similar to the narrations of Sufyan from Salamah bin Kuhail

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّأْمِينِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About At-Ta'min

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said "When the Imam says 'Amin' then (all of you) say 'Amin.' For whoever's 'Amin' concurs with the 'Amin' of the angels, then his past sins will be forgiven

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ التَّأْمِينِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of At-Tamin

hadiths.text: Al-Hasan narrated that :Samurah said: "there are two pauses that I preserved from Allah's Messenger." But Imran bin Husain rejected that and said: "We preserved one pause." "So we wrote to Ubayy bin Ka'b in Al-Madinah. Ubayy wrote that Samurah was correct." Sa'eed said: "We said to Qatadah: 'What are those two pauses?' He said: 'When he entered into his Salat, and when he finished his recitation.' Then he (Qatadah) said after that: 'And when he recited (Nor those who went astray.)' And he said: 'He liked to pause when he finished the recitation until he caught his breath

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي السَّكْتَتَيْنِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Two Pauses [During Salat]

hadiths.text: Qabisah bin Hulb narrated from :his father who said: "Allah's Messenger lead us in prayer and hold his left hand with his right

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَضْعِ الْيَمِينِ عَلَى الشِّمَالِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Placing The Right Hand Over The Left During the Salat

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated:"Allah's Messenger would say the Takbir for every lowering and raising, standing and sitting, and (so did) Abu Bakr and Umar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّكْبِيرِ عِنْدَ الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Takbir For The Bowing And Prostration Positions

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"Allah's Messenger would say the Takhir while he was going down

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ آخَرُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else

hadiths.text: Salim narrated from :his father (Ibn Umar) who said: "I saw Allah's Messenger when he opened the Salat, raising his hands to the level of his shoulders, and (again) when he bowed, and when he raised his head from bowing." In his narration, Ibn Abi Umar added: "And he wuld not raise them between the two prostrations

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ عِنْدَ الرُّكُوعِ
chapter.eng-name: Raising The Hands For the Bowing Position

hadiths.text: Salim narrated:Same as 255 (above) with a different chain

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي رَفْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ عِنْدَ الرُّكُوعِ
chapter.eng-name: Raising The Hands For the Bowing Position

hadiths.text: Alqamah narrated that :Abdullah bin Mas'ud said: "Shall I not demonstrate the Salat of Allah's Messenger to you?" Then he offered Salat and he did not raise his hands except while saying the first Takbir

grades.name: Badr al-Din al-Ayni
grades.source: كتاب شرح سنن أبي داود للعيني ج 2 ص 346 (https://shamela.ws/book/8540/1348#p1

grades.name: Ibn Al-Qataan Al-Faasi
grades.source: بيان الوهم والإيهام في كتاب الأحكام (https://shamela.ws/book/5923/946#p1)

grades.name: Darqutni
grades.source: کتاب العلل الدارقطنی ج 5 ص 172 سوال 804 (https://shamela.ws/book/9082/1503)

grades.name: Anwar Shah Kashmiri
grades.source: نيل الفرقدين في مسألة رفع اليدين ص 56

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم لَمْ يَرْفَعْ إِلاَّ فِي أَوَّلِ مَرَّةٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related That The Prophet (ﷺ) Would Not Raise His Hands Except For The First Time

hadiths.text: Abu Abdur-Rahman As-Sulami said:"Umar bin Al-Khattab [may Allah be pleased with him] said to us: 'The knees are the Sunnah for you, so hold the knees

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَضْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ عَلَى الرُّكْبَتَيْنِ فِي الرُّكُوعِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Placing the Hands On The Knees While Bowing

hadiths.text: Sa'd bin Abi Waqas said:"We would do that, but then we were prohibited from it, and we were ordered to put our hands on our knees

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَضْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ عَلَى الرُّكْبَتَيْنِ فِي الرُّكُوعِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Placing the Hands On The Knees While Bowing

hadiths.text: Abbas bin Sahl [bin Sa'd] narrated:"Abu Humaid, Abu Usaid, Sahl bin Sa'd, and Muhammad bin Maslamah were once together and they were mentioning the Salat of Allah's Messenger. Abu Humaid said: 'I am the most knowledgeable among you of the Salat of Allah's Messenger: Allah's Messenger would bow and place his hands on his knees as if he was grasping them, and he would draw his forearms to hold them away from his sides

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّهُ يُجَافِي يَدَيْهِ عَنْ جَنْبَيْهِ فِي الرُّكُوعِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Him (ﷺ) holding His Forearms Away From His Sides While Bowing.

hadiths.text: Ibn Mas'ud narrated that :the Prophet said: "When one of you bows then says while he is bowing: (Subhana Rabbiyal Azim) 'Glorious is my Lord the Magnificent' three times, then he has completed his bowing. And that is the least of it. And when he prostrates and says while prostrating: (Subhana Rabbiyal A'la) 'Glorious is my Lord the Most High' three times, then he has completed his prostrations, and that is the least of it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّسْبِيحِ فِي الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About At-Tasbih While Bowing And Prostrating

hadiths.text: Hudhaifah narrated that :he performed Salat with the Prophet, and that while he was bowing he would say: (Subhana Rabbiyal Azim); "Glorious is my Lord the Magnificent" and while prostrating: (Subhana Rabbiyal A'la) 'Glorious is my Lord the Most High.' And he would not recite an Ayah mentioning mercy, except that he would stop and ask (for mercy), and he would not recite an Ayah mentioning punishment, except that he would stop and seek refuge (with Allah from it)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّسْبِيحِ فِي الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About At-Tasbih While Bowing And Prostrating

hadiths.text: (Another similar narration) This Hadith has been narrated from Hudhaifah :from another route: "That he performed Salat during the night with the Prophet" and he mentioned the Hadith

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّسْبِيحِ فِي الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About At-Tasbih While Bowing And Prostrating

hadiths.text: Ali bin Abi Talib narrated:"The Prophet prohibited wearing Qassi, and that which is dyed with safflower, and from the gold ring, and from reciting the Quran while bowing

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي النَّهْىِ عَنِ الْقِرَاءَةِ، فِي الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Prohibiting Recitations While Bowing and Prostrating

hadiths.text: Abu Mas'ud Al-Ansari [Al-Badri] narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "The Salat is not acceptable if a man is not at rest - meaning his back - while bowing and prostrating

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ لاَ يُقِيمُ صُلْبَهُ فِي الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About One Who Does Not Bring His Back To Rest While Bowing and Prostrating

hadiths.text: Ali bin Abi Talib narrated:"When Allah's Messenger would raise his head from bowing he would say: (Sami Allahi liman hamidal. Rabba na lakal-hamd, mil'as-samawati wa mil'al-ardi wa mil'a ma bainahuma wa mil'a ma shi'ia min shay'in ba'd) 'Allah listens to those who praise Him. O our Lord! And to You is the praise that fills the heavens and fills the earth, and fills what is between them, and fills whatever there is beyond that You will.' He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn Umar, Ibn Abbas, Ibn Abi Awfa, Abu Juhaifa, and Abu Sa'eed

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ الرَّجُلُ إِذَا رَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ مِنَ الرُّكُوعِ
chapter.eng-name: What A Man Is To Say When Raising His Head From the Bowing Position

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When the Imam says: (Sami Allahu liman hamidah) 'Allah listens to those who praise Him. Then (all of you) say: (Rabbana wa lakal-hamd) 'O our Lord! And to You is the praise for whoever's saying concurs with the saying of the angels, then his past sins will be forgiven

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ آخَرُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Wa'il bin Hujr narrated:"I saw Allah's Messenger when he prostrated placing his knees (on the ground) before his hands, and when he got up, he raised his hands before his knees

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَضْعِ الرُّكْبَتَيْنِ قَبْلَ الْيَدَيْنِ فِي السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Placing The Knees (On The Ground) Before The Hands For Prostration

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :the Prophet said; "Is it that one of you intends to kneel in his Salat with the kneeling of the camel?

chapter.ara-name: باب آخَرُ مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Abu Humaid As-Sa'idi narrated:"When the Prophet would prostrate, he placed his nose and his forehead on the ground, and he held his forearms away from his sides, and he placed his hands parallel to his shoulders

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي السُّجُودِ عَلَى الْجَبْهَةِ وَالأَنْفِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Prostrating One the Forehead And The Nose

hadiths.text: Abu Ishaq narrated:"I said to Al-Bara bin Azib: 'Where would the Prophet place his face when he prostrated?' He said: 'Between his hands

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَيْنَ يَضَعُ الرَّجُلُ وَجْهَهُ إِذَا سَجَدَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Where A Man Placed His Face When He Prostrates

hadiths.text: Al-Abbas bin Abdul-Muttalib narrated that he heard :Allah's Messenger Saying: "When the worshipper prostrates with him: His face, his hands, his knees, and his feet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي السُّجُودِ عَلَى سَبْعَةِ أَعْضَاءٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Prostrating On Seven Bones

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"The Prophet ordered that one prostrate on seven bones and that he not gather his hair nor his garment

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي السُّجُودِ عَلَى سَبْعَةِ أَعْضَاءٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Prostrating On Seven Bones

hadiths.text: Ubaidallah bin Abdullah bin Arqam Al-Khuza'I narrated from his father (Abdullah bin Arqam), who said:"I was with my father at the plains of Namirah. I passed by a mount and saw Allah's Messenger standing in Salat." He said: "I was looking at the earthiness of his armpits when he prostrated." [That is]: "Whiteness

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّجَافِي فِي السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Holding The Forearms Away From The Sides During Prostration

hadiths.text: Jabir narrated that :the Prophet said: "When one of you prostrates, then let him be balanced, and let him not lay his forearms down like the lying of the dog

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِعْتِدَالِ فِي السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Being Balanced During Prostration

hadiths.text: Anas narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Be balanced in the prostration, and let one of you not spread his forearms (on the ground) in the Salat like the spreading of the dog

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِعْتِدَالِ فِي السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Being Balanced During Prostration

hadiths.text: Amir bin Sa'd [bin Abi Waqqas] narrated from his father:"The Prophet ordered placing the hands (on the ground) keeping the feet erect. (by resting feet on the toes and making the tips of the toes facing the Qiblah)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَضْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ وَنَصْبِ الْقَدَمَيْنِ فِي السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Placing The Hands and Planting The Feet During Prostration

hadiths.text: (Another chain that) Amir bin Sa'd narrated:"The Prophet ordered placing the hands (on the ground)." And he mentioned in it: "From his father

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَضْعِ الْيَدَيْنِ وَنَصْبِ الْقَدَمَيْنِ فِي السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Placing The Hands and Planting The Feet During Prostration

hadiths.text: Al-Bara bin Azib narrated:"The Salat of Allah's Messenger (was such that) when he bowed, and when he raised his head from bowing, and when he prostrated, and when he raised his head from prostration it (all) was nearly the same

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِقَامَةِ الصُّلْبِ إِذَا رَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ مِنَ الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Bringing The Backs To Rest When Raising One's Head From The Prostration And Bowing Positions

hadiths.text: Al-Bara bin Azib narrated:(Another chain) which is similar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِقَامَةِ الصُّلْبِ إِذَا رَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ مِنَ الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Bringing The Backs To Rest When Raising One's Head From The Prostration And Bowing Positions

hadiths.text: Al-Bara said:"When we performed Salat behind Allah's Messenger, he would raise his head from bowing, and no man among us would bend his back until Allah's Messenger prostrated, then we prostrated

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ أَنْ يُبَادَرَ الإِمَامُ بِالرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Dislike For Bowing And Prostrating Before The Imam

hadiths.text: Ali narrated:"Allah's Messenger said to me: 'O Ali! I love for you what I love for myself, and I dislike for you what I dislike for myself. Do not squat between prostrations

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الإِقْعَاءِ فِي السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Squat Between The Two Prostrations

hadiths.text: Tawus said:"We asked Ibn Abbas about squatting (sitting) on the heels. He said: 'It is the Sunnah.' We said: 'We think that it is difficult for a man.' He said: 'Rather, it is Sunnah of your Prophet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرُّخْصَةِ فِي الإِقْعَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Permission For Squatting

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"Between the two prostrations, the Prophet would say: (Allahummaghfir li, warhamni, wajburni, wahdini, warzuqni). 'O Allah! Pardon me, have mercy on me, help me, guide me, and grant me sustenance

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ بَيْنَ السَّجْدَتَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said Between The Two Prostrations

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:(Another chain) which is similar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ بَيْنَ السَّجْدَتَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said Between The Two Prostrations

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"[Some of] the Companions of the Prophet complained [to the Prophet] about the hardship of the prostration on them, when they were so spread out, so he said: 'Use your knees

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِعْتِمَادِ فِي السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Supporting Oneself During Prostration

hadiths.text: Malik bin Al-Huwairith Al-Laithi narrated that he saw :Allah's Messenger performing Salat. When he was in an odd number of his Salat, he would not get up until he had sat completely

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ كَيْفَ النُّهُوضُ مِنَ السُّجُودِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] How To Get Up From The Prostration

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"Allah's Messenger would get up during his Salat on the tips of his feet

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ أَيْضًا
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated:"Allah's Messenger taught us, that when we sit for every two Rak'ah we should say: (At-Tahyyatulillah, was-salawatu wattayybaat. As-salamu alaika ayyuhannabiyyu wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuhu, as-salamu alaina wa ala ibadillahis-salihin. Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah wa ashadu anna Muhammadan abduhu wa Rasuluh.) 'All greetings, prayers, and pure words are Allah. Peace be upon you O Prophet, and Allah's mercy and His blessings. Peace be upon us and all of the righteous worshippers of Allah. I testify that nne has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and I testify that Muhammad is Allah's servant and Messenger

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّشَهُّدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About At-Tashah-hud

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"Allah's Messenger would teach us the Tashah-hud just as he would teach us the Qur'an. He would say: (At-Tahiyyatu, al mubarakatu, as-salawatu at-tayyibatulillah. Salamun alaika ayyuhan-naibiyyu wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuhu, salamun alaina wa ala ibadalillahis-salihin. Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah, wa ashhadu anna Muhammadan abduhu wa Raduluh.) 'All greetings, goodness, prayers, and pure words are for Allah. Peace be upon you O Prophet, and Allah's mercy and His blessings, Peace be upon us and all of the righteous worshippers of Allah. I testify that there is none worthy of worship except Allah, and I testify that Muhammad is Allah's worshipper and Messenger

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ أَيْضًا
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas`ud said:"It is from the Sunnah to say the Tashahhud quietly

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّهُ يُخْفِي التَّشَهُّدَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Him Being Brief In At-Tashah-hud

hadiths.text: Wa'il bin Hujr said:"I arrived in Al-Madinah and I said, 'Let me look at the Salat of Allah's Messenger.' When he sat - meaning for At-Tashah-hud - he spread his left foot, and placed his left hand - meaning on his left thigh - and held his right foot erect

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ كَيْفَ الْجُلُوسُ فِي التَّشَهُّدِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] How To Sit During At-Tashah-hud

hadiths.text: Abbas bin SAhl [bin Sa'd] narrated:"Abu Humaid, Abu Usaid, Sahl bin Sa'd, and Muhammad bin Maslamah were once together and they were mentioning the Salat of Allah's Messenger. Abu Humaid said: "I am the most knowledgeable among you of the Salat of Allah's Messenger: Indeed Allah's Messenger sat - meaning for Tashah-hud - he spread his left foot, and made the top of his right (foot) face the Qiblah, and he placed his right hand on his right knee, and his left hand on his left knee, and indicated with his finger - meaning the index finge

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ أَيْضًا
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"When the Prophet would sit during the Salat, he would place his right hand on his knee, and raise his finger, the one that is next to the [right] thumb, supplicating with it, and his left hand was spread flat on his left knee

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الإِشَارَةِ فِي التَّشَهُّدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Indicating With The Finger [During At-Tashah-hud]

hadiths.text: Abdullah narrated:"The Prophet would say the Salam from his right and from his left (saying): (As-Salamu alaikum wa rahmatullah, as-Salamu alaikum wa rahmatullah) 'Peace be upon you, and Allah's mercy. Peace be upon you, and Allah's mercy

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّسْلِيمِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Taslim For Salat

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger would say one Taslim for the Salat while facing forward and turning to his right side a little

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ أَيْضًا
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"Hadhf the Salam is a Sunnah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ حَذْفَ السَّلاَمِ سُنَّةٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About: "Curtailing The Salam Is A Sunnah"

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"When Allah's Messenger said the Salam he would not remain seated except long enough to say: (Allahumma antas-salam, wa minkas-salam, tabarakta dhal jalali wal-Ikram) 'O Allah! You are the One free of defects, and perfection is from You. Blessed are You, Possessor of Majesty and Honor

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا سَلَّمَ مِنَ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said When Saying The Salam [After Salat]

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:(Another chain) which is similar, but he said: (Tabarakta ya dhal-jalali wal-ikram) "Blessed are You, O Possessor of Majesty and Honor

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا سَلَّمَ مِنَ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said When Saying The Salam [After Salat]

hadiths.text: Thawban, the freed slave of Allah's Messenger, narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When Allah's Messenger wanted to turn from his Salat, he would seek forgiveness from Allah three times, then say: (Allahumma Antas-Salam, wa minkas-salam, tabarakta ya dhal-jalali wal-Ikram) 'O Allah! You are the One free of defects and perfection is from You. Blessed are You, O Possesor of Majesty and Honor

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا يَقُولُ إِذَا سَلَّمَ مِنَ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said When Saying The Salam [After Salat]

hadiths.text: Qabisah bin Hulb narrated that his father said:"When Allah's Messenger would lead us in Salat he would turn (to leave) from both sides, on his right and on his left

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِنْصِرَافِ عَنْ يَمِينِهِ، وَعَنْ شِمَالِهِ،
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Turning From His Right And From His Left

hadiths.text: Rifa`ah bin Rafi` narrated:"One day Allah's Messenger was sitting in the Masjid" Rifa'ah said: "And we were with him. Then what appeared to be a Bedouin man entered to pray, but he performed his Salat in a very brief manner. He then got up and greeted the prophet with Salam. The Prophet said (returning the greeting): 'And upon you. Go back and perform Salat, for indeed you have no prayed.' So he returned to perform Salat then came and greeted the Prophet with Salam. So he (the Prophet) said (returning the greeting): 'And upon you. Go back and perform Salat, for indeed you have not prayed.' [He did that] two or three times, each time coming to the Prophet, greeted the Prophet with Salam and the Prophet saying: 'And upon you. Go back and perform Salat, for indeed you have not prayed.' - until the people got scared and became very worried that one whose prayer was so brief had not actually prayed. Then in the end the man said: 'Then show me, and teach me, for I am a human who has suffered and is mistaken.' So he said: 'Alright. When you stand for Salat then perform Wudu as Allah ordered you. Then say the Tashahhud, and the Iqamah as well. If you know any Quran then recite it, if not then praise Allah, mention His greatness, and the Tahlil. Then bow such that you are at rest in your bowing, then stand completely, then prostrate completely, then sit such that you are at rest while sitting them stand. When you have done that, then you have completed your Salat, and if you leave out something, then you have made your Salat deficient.' And this was easier on them than the first matter, because if some of this was deficient, It would only reduce the reward of his Salat, it would not have gone entirely

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَصْفِ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Description Of The Salat

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"Allah's Messenger entered the Masjid, and a man entered and offered Salat. Then he came to give Salam to the Propet. He returned the Salam to him and said: 'Go back and perform Salat, for indeed you have not prayed.' So the man returned to pray as he had prayed. Then he came to give Salam to the Prophet. He returned Salam to him, then [Allah's Messenger] said: 'Go back and perform Salat, for indeed you have not prayed' until he had done that three times. So the man said to him: 'By the One who sent you with the Truth, I do not know any better than this, so teach me.' So he said [to him]: 'When you stand for Salat then say the Takbir, then recite what is easy for you of the Quran. Then bow until you are at rest while bowing, then rise up until you are at rest sitting. Do that in all of your Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَصْفِ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Description Of The Salat

hadiths.text: Muhammad bin Amr bin Ata' narrated from Abu Humaid As-Saidi, :he (Muhammad) said: "I heard him saying - while he was among ten of the Companions of the Prophet, one of whom was Abu Qatadah bin Ribi - 'I am the most knowledgeable among you of the Salat of the Allah's Messenger.' They said: 'You did not precede us in his companionship, nor were you in his company more than us.' He said: 'Even still." They said: 'Go ahead.' So he said: 'When Allah's Messenger stood for Salat he would stand with his back straight and raise his hands until they were at the level of his shoulder. Then he would say: (Allahu Akbar) "Allah is Most Great" and bow. Then he would straighten (his back) so that he would not lower his head, nor raise it, and he placed his hands on his knees. Then he said: (Sami Allahu liman hamidah) "Allah listens to those who praise Him." And he raised his hands and stood up straight until all of his bones completely returned to their places. Then he went down to the ground prostrating, then he said: (Allahu Akbar) "Allah is Most Great." Then he held his upper arms away from his midsection, and opened his toes on his feet (facing the Qiblah), then he bend his left foot and sat on it then straightened up until all of his bones completely returned to their placed, then he went down to prostrate. Then he said: (Allahu Akbar) "Allah is Most Great," then he bent his foot and sat and straightened up until all of his bones completely returned to their places. Then he got up. Then in the second Rak'ah he did the same as that, such that when he stood from the two prostrations, he sad the Takbir and raised his hands until they were at the level of his shoulders as he did when he opened the Salat. Then he did like that until it was the Rak'ah in which his Salat was to end, when he moved his left foot over and sat on his side (in the Mutawarrik postion). Then he said the Taslim

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something else about that

hadiths.text: (Another chain) that Muhammad bin Amir bin Ata narrated from Abu Humaid As-Saidi,:he (Muhammad) said: "I heard him saying - while he was among ten of the Companions of the Prophet, one of whom was Abu Qatadah bin Ribi

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something else about that

hadiths.text: Qutbah bin Malik narrated:"I heard Allah's Messenger reciting for Fajr: And tall date palms in the first Rak'ah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي صَلاَةِ الصُّبْحِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Recitation For The Subh [(Fajr) Prayer]

hadiths.text: Jabir bin Samurah narrated:"For Zuhr and Asr, Allah's Messenger would recite: By the heavens, holding the Buruj and (By the heavens and At-Tariq) and similar to them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الظُّهْرِ وَالْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Recitation For Zuhr And Asr

hadiths.text: Umm Al-Fadl narrated:"Allah's Messenger came out to us with his head bandaged from his illness. He prayed Maghrib, reciting (Surat) Al-Mursalat." [She said:] "He did not pray it again until he met Allah the Might and Sublime

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related About] The Recitation For Maghrib

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Buraidah narrated that his father (Buraidah) said:"Allah's Messenger would recite: By the sun and its brightness, or similar Surah for the latter Isha (prayer)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Recitation For The Isha Prayer

hadiths.text: Al-Bara bin Azib narrated:"The Prophet would recite: By the fig and the olive for Isha

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقِرَاءَةِ فِي صَلاَةِ الْعِشَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Recitation For The Isha Prayer

hadiths.text: Ubadah bin As-Samit narrated:"Allah's Messenger prayed the Subh prayer, and he had difficulty with the recitation. When turned (after finishing) he said: 'I think that you are reciting behind your Imam?'" He said: "We said: 'Yes, Messenger of Allah, by Allah!' He said: 'Do not do that, except for Umm Al-Kitab, for there is no Salat for one who does not recite it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقِرَاءَةِ خَلْفَ الإِمَامِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Recitation Behind The Imam

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"Allah's Messenger turned (after praying) from a Salat in which he recited aloud and said: 'Has any one of you recite along with me just now?' A man said: 'Yes, O Messenger of Allah.' He said: 'Indeed I said to myself: Why was I being contended with for the Quran?'" He (Az-Zuhri one of the narrators) said: "So when they heard that from Allah's Messenger, the people stopped reciting with Allah's Messenger in the prayers that Allah's Messenger recited aloud

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَرْكِ الْقِرَاءَةِ خَلْفَ الإِمَامِ إِذَا جَهَرَ الإِمَامُ بِالْقِرَاءَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Not Reciting Behind The Imam When The Imam Is Reciting Aloud

hadiths.text: Abu Nu'aim Wahb bin Kaisan narated that he heard Jabir bin 'Abdullah saying:"Whoever prayed a Rak'ah in which he did not recite Umm Al-Qur'an, then he did not pray except if he was behind an Imam." [Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَرْكِ الْقِرَاءَةِ خَلْفَ الإِمَامِ إِذَا جَهَرَ الإِمَامُ بِالْقِرَاءَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Not Reciting Behind The Imam When The Imam Is Reciting Aloud

hadiths.text: Fatimah the Great narrated:"When Allah's Messenger entered the Masjid he said Salat and Salam upon Muhammad and then said: (Rabbighfirli dhunubi, waftahli abwaba rahmatik) 'O pardon my sins, and open the gates of Your mercy for me.' And when he exited he said Salat and Salam upon Muhammad, and then said: (Rabbighfirli dunubi, waftahli abwaba rakmatik) 'O Lord pardon my sins, and open the gates of Your blessings for me

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مَا يَقُولُ عِنْدَ دُخُولِ الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said When One Enters Into The Masjid

hadiths.text: Ismail bin Ibrahim (a narrator in the chain of Hadith no. 314) said:"I met Abdullah bin al Husain in Makkah, so I asked him about this Hadith, so he narrated it to me, he said: 'When Allah's Messenger entered, he said (Rabbi aftahli abwaba rahmatik) 'O Lord, open the gates of Your mercy for me.' And when he exited he said: (Rabbi iftahli abwaba fadlik) 'O Lord, open the gates of Your blessings for me

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مَا يَقُولُ عِنْدَ دُخُولِ الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Is Said When One Enters Into The Masjid

hadiths.text: Abu Qatadah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you comes to the Masjid, then let him perform two Rak'ah before sitting

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ إِذَا دَخَلَ أَحَدُكُمُ الْمَسْجِدَ فَلْيَرْكَعْ رَكْعَتَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'When One Of You Enters The Masjid Let Him Perform Two Rak'ah'

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "All of the earth is a Masjid except for the graveyard and the washroom

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ الأَرْضَ كُلَّهَا مَسْجِدٌ إِلاَّ الْمَقْبُرَةَ وَالْحَمَّامَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'All Of The Earth Is A Masjid, Except For The Graveyard And Washroom'

hadiths.text: Uthman bin Affan narrated that :he heard Allah's Messenger say: "Whoever builds a Masjid for (the sake of) Allah, then Allah will build a similar house for him in Paradise

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ بُنْيَانِ الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Building A Masjid

hadiths.text: It has been related that :the Prophet said: "Whoever builds a Masjid for (the sake of) Allah, be it small or large, then Allah will build a house for him in Paradise

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ بُنْيَانِ الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Building A Masjid

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbbas narrated:"Allah's Messenger cursed the women who visit the graves, and those who use them as Masajid and put torches on them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ أَنْ يَتَّخِذَ عَلَى الْقَبْرِ مَسْجِدًا
chapter.eng-name: Undesirability Of Taking The Grave As A Masjid

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"We would sleep in the Masjid during the time of Allah's Messenger and we were young men

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي النَّوْمِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Sleeping In The Masjid

hadiths.text: Amr bin Shu'aib narrated from his father, from his grandfather (Abdullah bin Amr Al-As), that :Allah's Messenger prohibited the recitation of poetry in the Masjid, and from selling and buying in it, and (he prohibited) the people from forming circles in it on Friday before the Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الْبَيْعِ وَالشِّرَاءِ وَإِنْشَادِ الضَّالَّةِ وَالشِّعْرِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Dislike For Buying, Selling, Loudly Seeking Out A Lost Item And Reciting Poetry In The Masjid

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated:"A man from Banu Khudrah and a man from Banu Amr bin Awf were disputing about the Masjid that was founded upon Taqwa. The man from Banu Khudrah said: 'It is the Masjid of Allah's Messenger.' The other one said that it was Masjid Qub. So they went to ask Allah's Messenger about that. He said: 'It is this - meaning his Masjid - 'and in that one (Masjid Quba) there is much good

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الَّذِي أُسِّسَ عَلَى التَّقْوَى
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Masjid Founded Upon Taqwa

hadiths.text: Abu Al-Abrad the freed slave of Banu Khatmah narrated that he heard Usaid bin Zuhair Al-Ansari - and he was one of the Companions of the Prophet - narrated that :the Prophet said: "The Salat in Masjid Quba is like Umrah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَسْجِدِ قُبَاءٍ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Salat Performed In Masjid Quba

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Salat is this Masjid of mine is better than a thousand Salat in another, except for Masjid Al-Haram

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي أَىِّ الْمَسَاجِدِ أَفْضَلُ
