chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Which Of The Masajid Are More Virtuous

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "A mount is not saddled (for a journey) except to three Masajid: Al-Masjid Al-Haram, this Masjid of mine, and Masjid Al-Aqsa." [Abu `Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي أَىِّ الْمَسَاجِدِ أَفْضَلُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Which Of The Masajid Are More Virtuous

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When the Iqamah is called for Salat do not come to it rushing, rather come to it walking, and while you have tranquility. What you catch of it then pray it, and what you missed of it, then complete it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَشْىِ إِلَى الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Walking To The Masjid

hadiths.text: (Another chain with a similar narration) from Abu Hurairah :[from the Prophet]. And this is more correct than the Hadith of Yazid bin Zurai. (no)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَشْىِ إِلَى الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Walking To The Masjid

hadiths.text: (Another chain with a similar narration) from Abu Hurairah, :from the Prophet

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْمَشْىِ إِلَى الْمَسْجِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Walking To The Masjid

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "One of you does not cease to be in Salat as long as he is waiting for it. And the angels do not cease praying for one of you as long as he remains in the Masjid (saying): 'Allah! Forgive him. O Allah! Have mercy upon him' - as long as he does not commit Hadath." A man from Hadramawt said: "And just what is Hadath Abu Hurairah?" He said: "Breaking wind, or passing gas

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقُعُودِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ وَانْتِظَارِ الصَّلاَةِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtues Of Sitting In The Masjid And Waiting For The Salat

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"Allah's Messenger performed Salat on a Khumrah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْخُمْرَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat On A Khumrah

hadiths.text: Abu Sa'eed narrated:"The Prophet performed Salat on a Hasir

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْحَصِيرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat On The Hasir (Mat)

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"Allah's Messenger used to mingle with us such that he said to my younger brother: 'O Abu Umair! What did the Nughair do?'" He (Anas) said: "A Bisat of ours would be sprinkled (with water) to perform Salat on

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الْبُسُطِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat On Busut

hadiths.text: Mu'adh ibn Jabal narrated:"The Prophet liked to perform Salat in Al-Hitan

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ فِي الْحِيطَانِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat In Al-Hitan

hadiths.text: Muba bin Talhah narrated from his father (Talhah) that :Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you placed something like the post (handle) of the camel saddle in front of him, then let him perform Salat and not concern himself with who passes beyond that

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي سُتْرَةِ الْمُصَلِّي
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Sutrah For The One Performing Salat

hadiths.text: Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhni sent a message to Abu Juhaim asking him what he had heard from Allah's Messenger about passing in front of a person who was performing Salat. Abu Juhaim said :that Allah's Messenger said: "If the one who passed in front of the person performing Salat knew what he was doing, then for him to stop (and wait for forty) would be better for him than to pass in front of him

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ الْمُرُورِ بَيْنَ يَدِيِ الْمُصَلِّي .
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Dislike for Passing In Front Of The Person Performing Salat

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"I was a companion rider on a female donkey with Al-Fadl. We came while the Prophet and his Companions were performing Salat at Mina." He said: "We dismounted from it and joined the row. The donkey then passed in front of them, and this did not invalidate their Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ لاَ يَقْطَعُ الصَّلاَةَ شَيْءٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'The Salat Is Not severed By Anything'

hadiths.text: Abu Dharr said that :Allah's Messenger said: "When a man performs Salat, and there is nothing in front of him like the post of a saddle, or a camel saddle, then his Salat is severed by (passing of) a black dog, a woman, and a donkey." It was said to Abu Dharr: "What is the problem with the black dog rather than the red or white one?" He said: "O my nephew! I asked Allah's Messenger just as you have asked me. He said: 'The black dog is a Shaitan (devil)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّهُ لاَ يَقْطَعُ الصَّلاَةَ إِلاَّ الْكَلْبُ وَالْحِمَارُ وَالْمَرْأَةُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'Salat Is Not Severed Except By A Dog, A Donkey, And A Woman'

hadiths.text: Umar bin Abi Salamah narrated that he saw :Allah's Messenger performing Salat in the house of Umm Salamah wrapped in one garment

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ فِي الثَّوْبِ الْوَاحِدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Performing Salat In One Garment

hadiths.text: Al-Bara bin Azib narrated:"When Allah's Messener arrived in Al-Madinah, he faced Bait Al-Maqdis in Salat for sixteen or seventeen months. Allah's Messenger longed to face the direction of the Ka'bah, so Allah Most High revealed: Verily! We have seen the turning of your face towards the heaven. Surely We shall turn you o a Qiblah that shall please you. So turn your face in the direction of Al-Masjid Al-Haram.So he faced the Ka'bah, and he liked that. A man performed the Asr prayer with him, then passed by some of the Ansar who were bowing in Salat for Asr while facing Bait Al-Maqdis." He told them that he had faced the direction of the Ka'bah, so they changed (their direction) while they were bowing." [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Ibn Umar, Ibn Abbas, Umarah bin Aws, Amr bin Awf Al-Muzani and Anas

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي ابْتِدَاءِ الْقِبْلَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Beginning Of The Qiblah

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar said:"They were bowing during the Subh (Fajr) Prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي ابْتِدَاءِ الْقِبْلَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Beginning Of The Qiblah

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "What is between the east and the west is Qiblah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ مَا بَيْنَ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ قِبْلَةٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'What Is Between The East And The West Is A Qiblah'

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:(Another chain with a similar narration)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ مَا بَيْنَ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ قِبْلَةٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'What Is Between The East And The West Is A Qiblah'

hadiths.text: (Another chain narrating that) Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "What is between the east and the west is Qiblah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ مَا بَيْنَ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ قِبْلَةٌ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'What Is Between The East And The West Is A Qiblah'

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Amir bin Rabi'ah narrated from his father who said:"We were with the Prophet on a journey on a very dark night and we did not know the direction of the Qiblah. So each man among us prayed in his own direction. In the morning when we mentioned that to the Prophet, then the following was revealed: So where ever you turn, there is the Face of Allah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي لِغَيْرِ الْقِبْلَةِ فِي الْغَيْمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Prays Facing A Direction Other Than The Qiblah When It Is Cloudy

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"The Prophet prohibited Salat from being performed in seven places: the dung heap, the slaughtering area, the graveyard, the commonly used road, the wash area, in the area that camels rest at, and above the House of Allah (the Ka'bah)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ مَا يُصَلَّى إِلَيْهِ وَفِيهِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About What Is Disliked To Face While Performing Salat, Or To Perform Salat In

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:(Another chain with a similar narration)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ مَا يُصَلَّى إِلَيْهِ وَفِيهِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About What Is Disliked To Face While Performing Salat, Or To Perform Salat In

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "Perform Salat in sheep pens but do not perform Salat in the camels' resting area

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَرَابِضِ الْغَنَمِ وَأَعْطَانِ الإِبِلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat In Sheep Pens And The Resting Area Of Camels

hadiths.text: (Another chain) from Abu Hurairah, :from the Prophet and it is the same or similar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَرَابِضِ الْغَنَمِ وَأَعْطَانِ الإِبِلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat In Sheep Pens And The Resting Area Of Camels

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"The Prophet would perform Salat in sheep pens

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ فِي مَرَابِضِ الْغَنَمِ وَأَعْطَانِ الإِبِلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat In Sheep Pens And The Resting Area Of Camels

hadiths.text: Jabir narrated:"The Prophet dispatched me for something he needed. I came to him while he was performing Salat on his mount, heading east, he made the prostrations lower than the bowing

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الدَّابَّةِ حَيْثُمَا تَوَجَّهَتْ بِهِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat On A Beast Whichever Direction It Is Facing

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"The Prophet performed Salat towards his she-camel, or his mount, and he would perform Salat while on his mount, whichever direction it was facing

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ إِلَى الرَّاحِلَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat Toward One's Mount

hadiths.text: Anas conveyed that :the Prophet said: "When supper is present and the Iqamah for Salat has been called, then begin with supper

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ " إِذَا حَضَرَ الْعَشَاءُ وَأُقِيمَتِ الصَّلاَةُ فَابْدَءُوا بِالْعَشَاءِ "
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'When Supper Is Present And The Iqamah Is Called For Salat Then Begin With Supper'

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that:the Prophet said: "When the supper is presented and the Iqamah is called for Salat, then begin with the supper

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ " إِذَا حَضَرَ الْعَشَاءُ وَأُقِيمَتِ الصَّلاَةُ فَابْدَءُوا بِالْعَشَاءِ "
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'When Supper Is Present And The Iqamah Is Called For Salat Then Begin With Supper'

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you is sleepy and he is performing Salat, then let him lie down until the sleep is gone from him. For when one of you performs Salat while he is sleepy, perhaps he wants to seek forgiveness but he curses himself

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ عِنْدَ النُّعَاسِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat When Sleepy

hadiths.text: Abu Atiyyah narrated that :a man among them said: "Malik bin Al-Huwairith came to us in our Musalla to narrate. One day when it was time for Salat, we told him to go ahead (to lead the prayer). He said: 'Let one of you go forward, until I narrate to you why I would not go forward (to lead prayer): I heard Allah's Messenger saying: "Whoever visits a people, then he does not lead them, but a man among them leads them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ زَارَ قَوْمًا لاَ يُصَلِّي بِهِمْ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related [About] 'Whoever Visits A People, He Does Not Lead Them In Salat'

hadiths.text: Thawban narrated that :the Prophet said: "It is not allowed for a man to look into the interior of a man's house until he has been given permission, for if he looks, then he has entered. And one who leads people (in Salat) should not supplicate for himself alone with the exclusion of his congregation. If he does, then he has betrayed them. And one is not to stand for Salat while he has to urinate

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ أَنْ يَخُصَّ الإِمَامُ نَفْسَهُ بِالدُّعَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked For The Imam To Specify Himself With Supplications

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"Allah's Messenger cursed three people: A man who leads people (in Salat) while they dislike him, a woman who spends a night while her husband is angry with her, and a man who hears: 'Hayya Alal Falah (come to success)' then does not respond

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ أَمَّ قَوْمًا وَهُمْ لَهُ كَارِهُونَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related [About] Whoever Leads People (In Salat) While They Dislike Him

hadiths.text: Amr bin Al-Harith Al-Mustaliq said:"It used to be said that the people with the worst punishment [on the Day of Judgment] are two: A woman who disobeyed her husband, and a people's Imam whom they dislike

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ أَمَّ قَوْمًا وَهُمْ لَهُ كَارِهُونَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related [About] Whoever Leads People (In Salat) While They Dislike Him

hadiths.text: Abu Umamah narrated that :Allah's Messenger said: "There are three whose Salat would not rise up beyond their ears: The runaway slave until he returns, a woman who spends a night while her husband is angry with her, and a people's Imam whom they dislike

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ أَمَّ قَوْمًا وَهُمْ لَهُ كَارِهُونَ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related [About] Whoever Leads People (In Salat) While They Dislike Him

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated:"Allah's Messenger fell from a horse and got injured, so he led Salat sitting and we also offered Salat sitting. When he completed the Salat he said: "The Imam is appointed to be followed; when he says the Takbir then say the Takbir, when he bows, then bow, and when he raises his head, then raise your heads. When he says: "Sami' Allahu liman hamidah (Allah listens to those who praise him)" then say: "Rabbana wa lakal-hamd. (O our Lord! And all praise is Yours.)" and when he prostrates, then prostrate, and when he performs Salat sitting, then pray sitting altogether

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ " إِذَا صَلَّى الإِمَامُ قَاعِدًا فَصَلُّوا قُعُودًا "
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related (On the Prophet's Saying) 'When The Imam Performs Salat While Seated, then You (People) Perform Salat Seated'

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger performed Salat behind Abu Bakr, during the illness from which he died, and he was sitting

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Anas narrated:"Allah's Messenger performed Salat during his illness behind Abu Bakr while seated, wrapped in a garment

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Ash-Sha'bi narrated:"Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah led us in Salat, and he continued after the two Rak'ah, so the people said: 'Subhan Allah' and he said: 'Subhan Allah' to them. When he finished his Salat he said the Taslim then performed two prostrations of As-Sahw while he was sitting. Then he narrated to them that Allah's Messenger did the same with them as he had done

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الإِمَامِ يَنْهَضُ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ نَاسِيًا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Imam Getting Up Forgetfully After Two Rak'ah

hadiths.text: Ziyad bin Haqah narrated:"Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah les us in Salat. When he prayed two Rak'ah he stood without sitting. Those who were behind him said 'Subhan Allah' and he indicated to them that they should stand. He said the Taslim when he had finished his Salat and he performed two prostrations of As-Sahw, and said the Taslim. He said that Allah's Messenger did this

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الإِمَامِ يَنْهَضُ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ نَاسِيًا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Imam Getting Up Forgetfully After Two Rak'ah

hadiths.text: Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated from his father (Abdullah bin Mas'ud) that he said:"When Allah's Messenger sat for the first two Rak'ah it was as if he was on hot stones." Shu'bah (one of the narrators) said: "Then Sa'd's lips moved (saying) something. So I said: 'Until he stood?' He said: 'Until he stood

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي مِقْدَارِ الْقُعُودِ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ الأُولَيَيْنِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About the Length Of The Sitting After The First Two Rak'ah

hadiths.text: Suhaib narrated:"I passed by Allah's Messenger (S) while he was performing Salat, so I said greeted him with Salam, and he returned it by making signals." He said: "I do not know except that he said: 'He indicated with his finger

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الإِشَارَةِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Making Signals During Salat

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"I said to Bilal: 'How did the Prophet (S) reply to them when they gave him Salams and he was performing Salat?' He said: 'He would motion with his hand

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الإِشَارَةِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Making Signals During Salat

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that:Allah's Messenger said: "The Tasbih is for the men and clapping is for the women

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ التَّسْبِيحَ لِلرِّجَالِ وَالتَّصْفِيقَ لِلنِّسَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The 'The Tasbih Is For The Men And Clapping Is For The Women'

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:"Yawning in prayer (salah) is from the Shaitan, so when one of you yawns then let him suppress (it) as much as possible

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ التَّثَاؤُبِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked to Yawn During Salat

hadiths.text: Imran bin Husain narrated:"I asked Allah's Messenger (S) about the Salat for a man who is sitting. He said: 'Whoever performs Salat while standing then that is more virtuous. And whoever performs Salat while sitting, then he gets half the rewards of the one standing, and whoever performs Salat while lying down, then he gets half the rewards of the one sitting

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ صَلاَةَ الْقَاعِدِ عَلَى النِّصْفِ مِنْ صَلاَةِ الْقَائِمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Salat While Sitting Is Half Of The Salat While Standing

hadiths.text: This Hadith has been related from Ibrahim bin Tahman with this chain. Except that he said:"From Imran bin Husain who said: 'I asked Allah's Messenger (S) about Salat for a sick person. He said: "He performs Salat standing, if he is not able then sitting, if he is not able then on his side

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ صَلاَةَ الْقَاعِدِ عَلَى النِّصْفِ مِنْ صَلاَةِ الْقَائِمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Salat While Sitting Is Half Of The Salat While Standing

hadiths.text: Hafsah, the wife of the Prophet (S), narrated:"I did not see Allah's Messenger (S) praying voluntary prayers sitting until the year before he died. Then he would perform Salat for the voluntary prayers sitting, and he would recite a Surah and prolong it such that it would be longer than the longest of them

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَتَطَوَّعُ جَالِسًا
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Voluntary Prayers While Sitting

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"The Prophet (S) would perform Salat while sitting. And he would recite while sitting. When about thirty or forty Ayah of his recitation remained he would standup and recite while he was standing, then he would bow and prostrate. Then he would do the same in the second Rak'ah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَتَطَوَّعُ جَالِسًا
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Voluntary Prayers While Sitting

hadiths.text: Abdullah bun Shaqiq narrated from Aishah, he said:"I asked her about the voluntary Salat of Allah's Messenger (S), she said: 'He would pray long into the night standing, and long into the night sitting. So when he recited and he was standing, he would bow and prostrate whole he was standing, and when he recited while he was sitting, he bowed and prostrated while he was sitting

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَتَطَوَّعُ جَالِسًا
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Voluntary Prayers While Sitting

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik narrated that:Allah's Messenger said: "Indeed I hear the crying of a small boy while I am in Salat, so I shorten it in fear that his mother may be tormented

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم قَالَ " إِنِّي لأَسْمَعُ بُكَاءَ الصَّبِيِّ فِي الصَّلاَةِ فَأُخَفِّفُ "
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Prophet (S) Saying: "I Hear The Crying Of A Small Boy During Salat and Shorten It"

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated that:Allah's Messenger said: "The Salat of a women who has reached the age of menstruation is not accepted without a Khimar

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ " لاَ تُقْبَلُ صَلاَةُ الْمَرْأَةِ إِلاَّ بِخِمَارٍ "
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'The Salat Of A Woman Who Has Reached The Age Of Menstruation Is Not Accepted Without A Khimar'

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"Allah's Messenger (S) prohibited As-Sadl in the Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ السَّدْلِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About As-Sadl Being Disliked During Salat

hadiths.text: Abu Dharr narrated that :the Prophet (S) said: "When one of you stands for Salat then he should not smoothen the pebbles, for indeed it is mercy that he is facing

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ مَسْحِ الْحَصَى فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Smooth The Pebbled During Salat

hadiths.text: Mu'aiqib narrated:"I asked Allah's Messenger (S) about smoothening the pebbles during Salat. He said: 'If you must do so, then let it be only once

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ مَسْحِ الْحَصَى فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Smooth The Pebbled During Salat

hadiths.text: Umm Salamah narrated:"The Prophet (S) saw a boy of ours - called Aflah - blowing when he prostrated. So he said: 'O Aflah! Put your face in the dirt

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ النَّفْخِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Blow During Salat

hadiths.text: (Another chain) in which Abu Hamzah narrated:"A boy of ours named Rabah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ النَّفْخِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Blow During Salat

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"The Prophet (S) prohibited than a man to pray with his hands on his hip

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي النَّهْىِ عَنْ الاِخْتِصَارِ، فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Prohibition Of Al-Ikhtisar (Holding The Hip) In Salat

hadiths.text: Abu Rafi narrated that :He passed by Al-Hasan bin Ali while he was performing Salat and he had gathered his locks at the back of his head, so he (Abu Rafi) undid them, and Al-Hasan turned to him angrily. He said: "Resume your Salat and do not be angry, for indeed I heard Allah's Messenger (S) saying: 'That is the seat of Ash-Shaitan

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ كَفِّ الشَّعْرِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked To Gather The Hair During Salat

hadiths.text: Al-Fadl bin Al-`Abbas narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "As-Salat is two and two, with a Tashahhud for every two Rak`ah, with humility, imploring, having a sense of tranquility, pleading and showing helplessness and stretching out your hand" - he said: raising them - "to your Lord, with the insides of them facing your face, saying: 'O Lord! O Lord! And whoever does not do this, then it is like this or that

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّخَشُّعِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Having Khushu' During Salat

hadiths.text: Ka'b bun Ujrah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "When one of you performs Wudu and does so well, then he leaves intending to go to the Masjid, then let him not intertwine his fingers, for indeed he is in Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَرَاهِيَةِ التَّشْبِيكِ بَيْنَ الأَصَابِعِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About It Being Disliked to Intertwine The Fingers During Salat

hadiths.text: Jabir narrated:"It was said to the Prophet (S): 'Which Salat is most virtuous?' He said: 'That with the longest Qunut

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي طُولِ الْقِيَامِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Lengthy Standing During Salat

hadiths.text: Ma'dan bin Talhah Al Yamari said:"I met Thawban the freed slave of Allah's Messenger (S) and said to him, 'Guide me to a deed by which Allah benefit me, and for which Allah will admit me into Paradise.' He was silent for quite a while, then he turned to me and said: 'Perform prostrations, for I heard Allah's Messenger (S) saying: 'No worshipper performs a prostration to Allah except that by it, Allah will raise him a level, and erase a sin from him for it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَثْرَةِ الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ وَفَضْلِهِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Performing Many Bowings and Prostrations [And Its Virtues]

hadiths.text: Madan [bin Talhah] said:"I met Abu Ad-Darda, and I asked him what I had asked Thawban, so he said: 'Perform prostrations, for I heard Allah's Messenger saying: 'No worshipper performs a prostration to Allah except that by it Allah will raise him a level, and erase a sin from him for it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي كَثْرَةِ الرُّكُوعِ وَالسُّجُودِ وَفَضْلِهِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Performing Many Bowings and Prostrations [And Its Virtues]

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"Allah's Messenger (S) ordered killing the two black things in Salat; the snake and the scorpion

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي قَتْلِ الْحَيَّةِ وَالْعَقْرَبِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Killing The Two Black Things In Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي سَجْدَتَىِ السَّهْوِ قَبْلَ التَّسْلِيمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Prostrations Of As-Sahw Before The Salaam

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي سَجْدَتَىِ السَّهْوِ قَبْلَ التَّسْلِيمِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Prostrations Of As-Sahw Before The Salaam

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Masud narrated:"The Prophet (S) prayed five (Rakah) for Zuhr, so it was said to him: 'Has the prayer been added to, or have you merely forgotten?' So he (S) performed two prostrations after he had said the Salam

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي سَجْدَتَىِ السَّهْوِ بَعْدَ السَّلاَمِ وَالْكَلاَمِ .
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Prostrations For As-Sahw After The Salam, And Talking

hadiths.text: Abdullah (bin Masud) narrated:"The Prophet (S) performed two prostrations for As-Sahw after talking

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي سَجْدَتَىِ السَّهْوِ بَعْدَ السَّلاَمِ وَالْكَلاَمِ .
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Prostrations For As-Sahw After The Salam, And Talking

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"The Prophet (S) performed two prostrations after the Salam

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي سَجْدَتَىِ السَّهْوِ بَعْدَ السَّلاَمِ وَالْكَلاَمِ .
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Prostrations For As-Sahw After The Salam, And Talking

hadiths.text: Abu Al-Muhallab narrated from Imran bin Husain that :the Prophet (S) led them in Salat he forgot (something) so he performed two prostrations, then the Tashah-hud, then the Salam

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّشَهُّدِ فِي سَجْدَتَىِ السَّهْوِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Tashah-hud In The Case Of The Prostrations Of As-Sahw

hadiths.text: Iyad bin Hilal said:"I said to Abu Sa'eed: 'One of us performs Salat and we do not know how (much) we prayed.' So he said: 'Allah's Messenger (S) said: "When one of you performs Salat and he does now know how (much) he prayed then let him perform two prostrations while he is sitting

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي فَيَشُكُّ فِي الزِّيَادَةِ وَالنُّقْصَانِ
chapter.eng-name: Regarding One Who Has Doubts Over Addition Or A Omission

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "Indeed the Shaitan comes to one of you in his Salat confusing him until he does now know how much he has prayed. When one of you experiences that then let him perform two prostrations while sitting

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي فَيَشُكُّ فِي الزِّيَادَةِ وَالنُّقْصَانِ
chapter.eng-name: Regarding One Who Has Doubts Over Addition Or A Omission

hadiths.text: Abdur-Rahman bi Awf narrated that he heard the Prophet (S) saying:"When one of you becomes forgetful in his Salat so that he does not know if he prayed one or two, then let him consider it one. When he does not know if he prayed three or four, then let him consider it three, and let him perform two prostrations before he says the Taslim

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي فَيَشُكُّ فِي الزِّيَادَةِ وَالنُّقْصَانِ
chapter.eng-name: Regarding One Who Has Doubts Over Addition Or A Omission

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated:"The Prophet (S) turned (finished the prayer) after two (Rak'ah), so Dhul-Yadain said: 'Has the prayer been shortened or have you forgotten O Messenger of Allah?" The Prophet (S) said: 'Is what Dhul-Yadain said the truth?' The people said yes, so Allah's Messenger (S) stood to perform the last two (Rakah) of Salat, then he said the Taslim. Then he said the Takbir and prostrated in a manner the same or longer than his (normal) prostrations

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُسَلِّمُ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ مِنَ الظُّهْرِ وَالْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Says The Taslim After Two Rakah During The Zuhr Or Asr Prayers

hadiths.text: Sa'eed bin Yazid Abu Maslamah said:"I said to Anas bin Malik: 'Would Allah's Messenger (S) perform Salat wearing his sandals?' He said: 'Yes

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ فِي النِّعَالِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat In Sandals

hadiths.text: Al-Bara bin Azib narrated:"The Prophet (S) would perform the Qunut in the Subh and Maghrib prayers

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْقُنُوتِ فِي صَلاَةِ الْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Qunut In The Fajr Prayer

hadiths.text: Abu Malik Al-Ashjai narrated:"I said to my father: 'O my father! You offered Salat behind Allah's Messenger (S), Abu Bakr, Umar, Uthman, and Ali bin Abi Talib here in Al-Kufah for about five years. Did they say the Qunut?' He said: 'It is a newly invented matter my son

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَرْكِ الْقُنُوتِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Not Performing The Qunut

hadiths.text: There is another narration from Abu Malik:There exists another narration from Abu Malik with similar meaning but with different chain

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَرْكِ الْقُنُوتِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About Not Performing The Qunut

hadiths.text: Muadh bin Rifa'ah narrated that his father said:"I prayed behind Allah's Messenger (S). I sneezed and said: Al-Hamdulillah, hamdan kathiran tayyiban mubarakan fih, mubarakan alaihi kama yuhibbu Rabbana Wa Yarda (All praise is due to Alah, many good blessed praises, blessings for Him as our Lord loves and is pleased with.) When Allah's Messenger (S) prayed and turned (after finishing) he said: 'Who was the speaker during the Salat?' No one spoke. Then he said it a second time: 'Who was the speaker during the Salat?' But no one spoke. Then he said it a third time: 'Who was the speaker during the Salat?'" So Rifa'ah bin Rafi bin Afra said: "It was I, O Messenger of Allah (S)." He said: "What did you say?" He said: "I said: 'Al-Hamdulillah, hamdan kathiran tayyiban mubarakan fih, mubarakan alaihi kama yuhibbu Rabbana Wa Yarda. The Prophet (S) said: "By the One in Whose Hand is my soul! I saw thirty-some angels competing over which of then would ascend with it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَعْطُسُ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Sneezing During Salat

hadiths.text: Zaid bin Arqam narrated:"We used to talk behind Allah's Messenger (S) during the Salat, a man among us would talk to his companions next to him until (the following) was revealed: And stand before Allah with obedience. (2:238) So we were ordered to be silent and prohibited from talking

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي نَسْخِ الْكَلاَمِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: [What Has Been Related] About The Abrogation Of Speech During The Salat

hadiths.text: Asma bin Al-Hakam Al-Fazari said:"I heard Ali saying: 'Indeed I am a man who, when I heard a Hadith from Allah's Messenger (S) then Allah causes me to benefit from it as much as He wills for me to benefit from it. When a man among his Companions narrated to me I ask him to swear an oath to me about it, and when he swears an oath to me I trust him. And Abu Bakr narrated to me - and Abu Bakr told the truth - he said: "I heard Allah's Messenger (S) saying: 'There is no man who commits a sin, then makes Wudu, then performs Salat, then seeks forgiveness from Allah, except that Allah forgives him.' Then he recited this Ayah: Those who when they have committed Fahishah or wronged themselves with eveil, remember Allah. (3:135) until the end of the Ayah

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ عِنْدَ التَّوْبَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat With Repentance

hadiths.text: (Sabrah bin Ma'bad al-Juhni) narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "Teach the boy Salat when he is seven years old, and beat him (if he does not pray) when he is ten

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ مَتَى يُؤْمَرُ الصَّبِيُّ بِالصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About When A Boy Is Ordered To Perform Salat

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Amr narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "When he commits Hadath - meaning a man - and he is sitting in the end of his Salat before saying the Taslim, then his Salat is acceptable

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّجُلِ يُحْدِثُ فِي التَّشَهُّدِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About A Man Who Commites Hadath After The Tashah-hud

hadiths.text: Jabir narrated:"We were with the Prophet (S) on a journey when it started to rain on us, so the Prophet (S) said: 'Whoever wishes, let him perform Salat in his place

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ إِذَا كَانَ الْمَطَرُ فَالصَّلاَةُ فِي الرِّحَالِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'When It Rains Then Salat Is Performed At One's Place'

hadiths.text: Ibn Abbas narrated:"Some of the poor people came to Allah's Messenger (S) and said: 'O Messenger of Allah (S)! The rich pray as we pray, they fast as we fast, but they have wealth with which they free slaves and which they give in charity.' He said: 'When you perform Salat, then say: 'Subhan Allah' thirty-three times, and: 'Al-Hamdulillah' thirty-three times, and: 'Allahu Akbar' thirty-four times, and 'La ilaha illallah' ten times. With that you will have surprassed them, and none would surpass you afterwards

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي التَّسْبِيحِ فِي أَدْبَارِ الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About At-Tasbih At The End Of Salat

hadiths.text: Amr bin Uthman bin Ya'la bin Murrah narrated from his father, from his grand-father that :They were with the Prophet (S) on a journey. They wound up in a narrow area when Salat became due. Then it began raining from the sky above them, and it was wet beneath them. So Allah's Messenger (S) called the Adhan while he was on his mount, and then the Iqamah, going forward on his mount. He let them in Salat by making gestures, making his prostrations lower than his bowing

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى الدَّابَّةِ فِي الطِّينِ وَالْمَطَرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Salat On The Riding Animal During Muddy And Rainy Conditions

hadiths.text: Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah narrated:"Allah's Messenger (S) performed Salat until his feet were swollen, so it was said to him: 'You burden yourself like this, while your past and future sins have been forgiven?' He said: 'Shouldn't I be a grateful worshipper?

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِجْتِهَادِ فِي الصَّلاَةِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Striving With The Salat

hadiths.text: Huraith bin Qabisah narrated:"I arrived in Al-Madinah and said: 'O Allah! Facilitate me to be in a righteous gathering.'" He said: "I sat with Abu Hurairah and said: 'Indeed I asked Allah to provide me with a righteous gathering. So narrate a hadith to me which you heard from Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) so that perhaps Allah would cause me to benefit from it.' He said: 'I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say: "Indeed the first deed by which a servant will be called to account on the Day of Resurrection is his Salat. If it is complete, he is successful and saved, but if it is defective, he has failed and lost. So if something is deficient in his obligatory (prayers) then the Lord, Mighty and Sublime says: 'Look! Are there any voluntary (prayers) for my worshipper?' So with them, what was deficient in his obligatory (prayers) will be completed. Then the rest of his deeds will be treated like that

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ أَوَّلَ مَا يُحَاسَبُ بِهِ الْعَبْدُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ الصَّلاَةُ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'The First Thing The Slave (Of Allah) Will Be Reckoned For On The Day Of Judgement Is The Salat'

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated that Allah's Messenger (S) said:"Whoever is regular with twelve Rak'ah of Sunnah (prayer), Allah will build a house for him in Paradise: Four Rak'ah before Zuhr, two Rak'ah after it, two Rak'ah after Maghrib, two Rak'ah after Isha, and two Rak'ah before Fajr

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ صَلَّى فِي يَوْمٍ وَلَيْلَةٍ ثِنْتَىْ عَشْرَةَ رَكْعَةً مِنَ السُّنَّةِ وَمَا لَهُ فِيهِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About One Who Prays Twelve Rak'ah Of Sunnah In A and Night, And What Virtues He Will Have For That

hadiths.text: Umm Habibah narrated that Allah's Messenger (S) sad:"Whoever prays twelve Rak'ah in a day and night, a house will be built from him in Paradise: Four Rak'ah before Zuhr, two Rak'ah after it, two Rak'ah after Maghrib, two Rak'ah after Isha, and two Rak'ah before Fajr in the morning Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ صَلَّى فِي يَوْمٍ وَلَيْلَةٍ ثِنْتَىْ عَشْرَةَ رَكْعَةً مِنَ السُّنَّةِ وَمَا لَهُ فِيهِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About One Who Prays Twelve Rak'ah Of Sunnah In A and Night, And What Virtues He Will Have For That

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated that :Allah's Messenger (S) said: "The two Rak'ah of Fajr are better than the world and what is in it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي رَكْعَتَىِ الْفَجْرِ مِنَ الْفَضْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of The Two Rak'ah (Before) Fajr

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"I watched the Prophet (S) for a month. In the two Rak'ah before Fajr he would recite: Say: "O you disbelievers!" and Say: "Allah is One

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي تَخْفِيفِ رَكْعَتَىِ الْفَجْرِ وَمَا كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَقْرَأُ فِيهِمَا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Brevity Of The Two Rak'ah Of Fajr And What The Prophet (S) Would Recite In Them

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"When Allah's Messenger (S) prayed the two Rak'ah (before) Fajr if he needed something from me he would talk to me, if not, he would go to Salat

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْكَلاَمِ بَعْدَ رَكْعَتَىِ الْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Talking After The Two Rak'ah (Before) Fajr

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "There is no Salat after Al-Fajr (begins) except two prostrations

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ " لاَ صَلاَةَ بَعْدَ طُلُوعِ الْفَجْرِ إِلاَّ رَكْعَتَيْنِ "
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'There Is No Salat After Fajr Begins Except For Two Rak'ah'

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "When one of you prays the two Rak'ah of Fajr then let him lay down on his right (side)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الاِضْطِجَاعِ بَعْدَ رَكْعَتَىِ الْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Lying On One's Side After The Two Rak'ah Of Fajr

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "When the Iqamah has been called for the Salat then there is no Salat except the obligatory

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ " إِذَا أُقِيمَتِ الصَّلاَةُ فَلاَ صَلاَةَ إِلاَّ الْمَكْتُوبَةُ "
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About 'When The Iqamah Has Been Called For Salat Then There Is No Salat But The Obligatory'

hadiths.text: Qais narrated:"Allah's Messenger (S) went out and the Iqamah was called for the Salat so I prayed As-Subh with him. Then the Prophet (S) turned and found me performing Salat so he said: 'Easy O Qais! Are there two prayers together?' I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I did not perform the two Rak'ah (before) Fajr.' He said: 'Then there is no harm

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِيمَنْ تَفُوتُهُ الرَّكْعَتَانِ قَبْلَ الْفَجْرِ يُصَلِّيهِمَا بَعْدَ صَلاَةِ الْفَجْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About One Who Misses The Two Rak'ah Before Fajr Praying Them After The Subh Prayer

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "Whoever did not pray the two Rak'ah (before) Fajr then let him pray them after the sun has risen

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي إِعَادَتِهِمَا بَعْدَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Waiting To Perform Them After The Sun Has Risen

hadiths.text: Ali narrated:"The Prophet (S) would pray four Rak'ah before Az-Zuhr and two Rak'ah after it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الأَرْبَعِ قَبْلَ الظُّهْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Four Rak'ah Before Az-Zuhr

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"I prayed two Rak'ah with the Prophet (S) before Az-Zuhr and two Rak'ah after it

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ بَعْدَ الظُّهْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Two Rak'ah After Az-Zuhr

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"When the Prophet (S) would not perform the four Rak'ah before Az-Zuhr he would pray them after it

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ آخَرُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Umm Habibah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "Whoever prays four before Az-Zuhr and four after, Allah makes him prohibited for the Fire

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ آخَرُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Umm Habibah the wife of the Prophet (S) narrated that:She heard Allah's Messenger (S) saying: "Whoever maintains four Rak'ah before Az-Zuhr and four after it, Allah makes him prohibited for the Fire

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ آخَرُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That

hadiths.text: Ali narrated:"Allah's Messenger (S) would pray four Rak'ah before Al-Asr separating between them with At-Taslim upon the angels that are close (to Allah) and those who follow them among the Muslims and the believers

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الأَرْبَعِ قَبْلَ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Four (Rak'ah) Before Asr

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that :The Prophet (S) said: "May Allah have mercy upon a man who prays four before Al-Asr

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الأَرْبَعِ قَبْلَ الْعَصْرِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Four (Rak'ah) Before Asr

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated:"I can not enumerate (how many times) I heard Allah's Messenger (S) reciting - in the two Rak'ah after Al-Maghrib and the two Rak'ah before Salatul-Fajr with: Say: "O you disbelievers!" and Say: "He is Allah the One

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ بَعْدَ الْمَغْرِبِ وَالْقِرَاءَةِ فِيهِمَا
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Two Rak'ah After Al-Maghrib And The Recitation In Them

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"I prayed two Rak'ah after Al-Maghrib with the Prophet (S) in his house

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّهُ يُصَلِّيهِمَا فِي الْبَيْتِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Him (S) Praying Them In The House

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated:"I memorized ten Rak'ah from Allah's Messenger (S) which he would pray in a night and a day: Two Rak'ah before Az-Zuhr, two after it; two Rak'ah after Al-Maghrib and two Rak'ah after the latter Isha." He said: "And Hafsah narrated to me that he (S) would pray two Rak'ah before Al-Fajr

chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Him (S) Praying Them In The House

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "Whoever prays six Rak'ah after Al-Maghrib, and he does not speak about anything between them, then they will be counted for him as twelve years of worship

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ التَّطَوُّعِ وَسِتِّ رَكَعَاتٍ بَعْدَ الْمَغْرِبِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Six Voluntary Rak'ah After Al-Maghrib

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Shaqiq said:"I asked Aishah about the Salat of Allah's Messenger (S). She said: 'He would pray four Rak'ah before Az-Zuhr and two Rak'ah after it, and two after Al-Maghrib, and two Rak'ah after Al-Isha, and two before Al-Fajr

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ بَعْدَ الْعِشَاءِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Two Rak'ah After Isha

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that:The Prophet (S) said: "Salat in the night is two by two. So when you fear the dawn (is near) then make it odd by one, and make that the last of your Salat odd

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ أَنَّ صَلاَةَ اللَّيْلِ مَثْنَى مَثْنَى
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Salat Of The Night Is Two By Two

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "The most virtuous fasting after the month of Ramadan is that of Allah's month of Al-Muharram. And the most virtuous Salat after the obligatory is the night prayer

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ صَلاَةِ اللَّيْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Salat During The Night

hadiths.text: Sa'eed bin Abi Sa'eed Al-Maqburi narrated that:Sa'eed bin Abi Sa'eed Al-Maqburi narrated that Abu Salamah informed him that he had asked Aishah: "How was the Salat of Allah's Messenger (A) [at night] during Ramadan?" She said: "Allah's Messenger (S) would pray - neither in Ramadan nor in any other month - more than eleven Rak'ah. He would pray four, and do not ask about their excellence or length, then he would pray four, and do not ask about their excellence or length, then he would pray three." Aishah said: "I asked: 'O Messenger of Allah! Do you sleep before having performed Witr?" He said: 'O Aishah! Indeed my eyes sleep but my heart does not sleep

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي وَصْفِ صَلاَةِ النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِاللَّيْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Description Of The Night Prayer Of The Prophet (S)

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"Allah's Messenger (S) would pray eleven Rak'ah at night, making them off with one. When he finished them he would lay down on his right side

chapter.ara-name: باب مِنْهُ
chapter.eng-name: Something Else About That (Night Prayer)

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"When the Prophet (S) did not pray at night because he was prevented from it by sleep or being sleepy then he would pray twelve Rak'ah during the daytime

chapter.ara-name: باب إِذَا نَامَ عَنْ صَلاَتِهِ، بِاللَّيْلِ صَلَّى بِالنَّهَارِ
chapter.eng-name: When One Sleeps Past The Night Prayer He Prays It During The Daytime

hadiths.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that:Allah's Messenger (S) said: "Allah, Blessed and Exalted is He, descends to the earth's heaven every night when the first third of the night has passed. He says: "I am the Sovereign. Is there any who calls upon Me so that I may respond to him? Is there any who asks of Me that I may give him? Is there any who seeks forgiveness from Me so that I may forgive him?' He continues in that until the illumination of Al-Fajr

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي نُزُولِ الرَّبِّ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ إِلَى السَّمَاءِ الدُّنْيَا كُلَّ لَيْلَةٍ
chapter.eng-name: [What Had Been Related] About The Lord Blessed And Exalted Is He, Descending To The Earth's Heaven Every Night

hadiths.text: Abu Qatadah narrated that :The Prophet (S) said to Abu Bakr: "I passed by you while you were reciting and your voice was low." He said: "I let He who, I was consulting hear." He said: "Raise your voice." Then he said to Umar: "I passed by while you were reciting and your voice was loud." So he said: "I repel drowsiness and keep Ash-Shaitan away." So he said: "Lower your voice

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي قِرَاءَةِ اللَّيْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Recitation During The Night

hadiths.text: Aishah narrated:"The Prophet (S) stood (in prayer) with an Ayah from the Qur'an at night

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي قِرَاءَةِ اللَّيْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Recitation During The Night

hadiths.text: Abdullah bin Abi Qais narrated:"I asked Aishah how the recitation of the Prophet (S) was at night. [Would he recite silently o audibly?] So she said: 'He would do both of those. Sometimes he was silent with his recitation and sometimes it was audible.' So I said: 'All praise is due to Allah, the One who made the matter broad

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي قِرَاءَةِ اللَّيْلِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Recitation During The Night

hadiths.text: Zaid bin Thabit narrated that:The Prophet (S) said: "The most virtuous prayer of yours is in your homes, except for the obligatory

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي فَضْلِ صَلاَةِ التَّطَوُّعِ فِي الْبَيْتِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About The Virtue Of Voluntary Salat In The House

hadiths.text: Ibn Umar narrated that :The Prophet (S) said: "Offer Salat in your homes and do not turn them into graves
